job.title: Health & Safety Specialist
job.description: Health & Safety Specialist-10160455DescriptionCintas is currently seeking a professional for our Health & Safety Specialist position. This position requires the ability to facilitate training courses and instruct on OSHA, First Aid, CPR, and other safety topics. Job duties will include instructing and facilitating OSHA and other safety courses, selling and scheduling training, upselling safety and first aid products to our training customers, and working with the service team to ensure customer satisfaction and OSHA compliance.Qualifications• Experience in training, teaching, or facilitating preferred• High School Diploma or GED required, college degree preferred• Familiarity with safety products and requirements• Valid driver's license• Business to business, industrial and/or outside sales experience is preferredOur Health & Safety Specialists enjoy:• Competitive Pay• 401(k)/Profit sharing/ESOP• Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Package• Disability & Life Insurance Package• Paid Vacation & Holidays• Career Advancement OpportunitiesFor more than 45 years, Cintas Corporation has offered highly-specialized services to businesses of all types. Cintas provides uniforms, facility services, safety supplies, fire protection solutions, flame resistant clothing, cleanroom resources, and promotional products. We are the service professionals, providing countless supplies and services to businesses small and large throughout the world. We operate in 420 facilities including, six manufacturing sites and nine distribution centers. We also have one of the largest fleets in North America. To support our aggressive growth plans, we offer unique opportunities, including advancement, ongoing training, mentoring and the opportunity to develop world class business skills.Cintas is Team Driven, and the true spirit we share gives us a competitive edge. We win together by working together as a team, giving mutual respect to all of our co-workers regardless of their background or tenure.The engine of Cintas’ team driven approach is our culture, which drives our profitability and stability. It’s a culture that exudes a high degree of professionalism at every level of our business. It’s a culture that maximizes the career development of all of our employee-partners, regardless of their job title and description.Cintas Corporation is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and will make all employment related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.Job Category: ServiceLocation: US-PA-ConshohockenOrganization: FAS/FireEmployee Status: RegularSchedule: Full-timeShift: First Apply on Career Site

job.title: Associate Analyst, IT Help Desk
job.description: Req Id 13261 - Posted 03/25/2015 - Information Systems & Technology - King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, USThis Associate Analyst, IT (Information Technology) Help Desk provides Level 1 telephone/email support of PC hardware, software, enterprise applications and users to Arkema's North American client-base.Context and environment:- Arkema's IS&T (Information Services & Technology) Help Desk receives ~22,000 contacts annually- Supports ~2,500 employees across 30+ facilities, including manufacturing facilities operating on a 24x7 schedule (After hours emergency coverage has a targeted / specific scope)- North American network & support base includes: 2,700 LAN accounts, 2,300 workstations, 50 public warehouses- Scope includes enterprise applications, remote connectivity, LAN connectivity, desktop applications, manufacturing applications, Windows, mobile devices, messaging, collaboration tools, etc.Specific job activities include (but are not limited to):- Perform Level 1 support for incoming contacts to IT Help Desk. Contacts received via phone call, email and voice mail. Contacts include system issues, questions, service requests, training.- Evaluate, prioritize, troubleshoot, analyze, research and resolve Level 1 PC hardware/software and application incidents reported by clients. Answer client questions. Scope includes enterprise applications, remote connectivity, LAN connectivity, desktop applications, Windows 7, mobile devices, messaging, collaboration tools, etc.- Assess issues for transfer to Level 2/3 IS&T support teams where indicated. Update Service Desk SharePoint knowledge database with technical support documentation.- Demonstrate technology and provide ad hoc training on IT and PC processes to clients. Direct clients to published documentation for sustainable knowledge transfer. Identify gaps and generate new/revised user documentation as needed.- Observe and escalate trends in reported issues. Identify requirement to communicate information and status on widespread issues to client base.- Rotating after-hours support: Central point of contact for designated business-critical issues. Receive client call, analyze issue. Either resolve with client or transfer issue to responsible Level 2/3 IS&T personnel as required.- Record all contacts in global Service Management Tool (SMART). Document resolutions in SMART.- Record enrollment requests for Internet, remote network access, and other infrastructure components for transfer to Level 2 support. Process password resets for SAP, Windows, Domino, Lotus Notes, and other applications.- Perform ongoing monitoring of enterprise PC virus activity via Kaspersky anti-virus application dashboards. Investigate virus alerts and make necessary updates on user PCs. Resolve or escalate issues to Front Office Team (Level 3) as needed.- Execute assignments in the areas of user training, continuous improvement, documentation, software upgrades and deployment, application testing, etc.- Support global and regional IS&T project requirements as needed (hardware / software installs, support documentation, user training, call tracking). Travel may be required.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:- Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business, or related field, or related relevant work experience- Minimum of 1-2 years experience in an IT help desk team environment and/or demonstrated knowledge of desktop applications and tools- Preferred skills in PC configurations, diagnostics/troubleshooting techniques. Preferred software skills in Windows 7, Lotus Notes, Microsoft Office, SharePoint, Internet Explorer, Blackberry, WebEx, and other standard personal productivity and collaborative applications.- Demonstrate problem-solving, root cause analysis and troubleshooting. Determine breadth of impact and provide rapid development of corporate communications in response to enterprise-wide issues (System Status, 7500 Service Desk line)- Demonstrate effective customer service and problem solving skills. Exceptional interpersonal skills are required to work with people from a wide range of organizations and levels. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.- Demonstrate ability to effectively interact within teams, work independently- Interest in learning various aspects of key activities to develop technical/business/professional knowledge needed at current and future position. Learn how own actions impact Arkema as a business.- Compliance with safety procedures for a safe work environment.A global chemical company and France's leading chemicals producer, Arkema is building the future of the chemical industry every day. Deploying a responsible, innovation based approach, we produce state-of-the-art specialty chemicals that provide customers with practical solutions to such challenges as climate change, access to drinking water, the future of energy, fossil fuel preservation and the need for lighter materials. With operations in more than 40 countries, 14,000 employees, 80 production facilities and 10 research centers, Arkema generates annual revenue of $8.1 billion and holds leadership positions in all its markets with a portfolio of internationally recognized brands. In North America, Arkema, Inc., a subsidiary of Arkema is headquartered in King of Prussia, PA. Arkema Inc. employs 2,400 people and operates 32 facilities in the US, Canada, Mexico and Brazil.Arkema Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Arkema Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.For more information about the EEOC, please refer to The "EEO IS The Law" poster at http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf Apply on Career Site

job.title: Functional Sales & Distribution Consultant
job.description:
Requisition ID: 51304Work Area: SalesExpected Travel: 0 - 10%Career Status: ProfessionalEmployment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
As market leader in enterprise application software, SAP helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. From the back office to the boardroom, warehouse to storefront, on premise to cloud, desktop to mobile device – SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively to stay ahead of the competition. SAP applications and services enable customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES:
The Functional SD Consultant facilitates the implementation and support of SAP products to enhance the clients’ business functionality and overall performance, while maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction. 3-5 years professional Order to Cash business experience w/ a minimum of 2-3 full years of SAP product/implementation experience and/or 2+ years of SAP Sales & Distribution (SD) application/implementation experience required. Strong understanding of SAP, its products and solutions, partners, markets and competition. Consultant should have the capability of effectively interacting with and presenting to appropriate levels of the client organization in formal presentations and informal discussions. Strong interpersonal and presentation skills. SAP project experience across ECC with an understanding of all SD components including pricing, order management, shipping and billing along with integration knowledge to MM, PP and FI/CO.
Position Duties and Responsibilities: Responsible primarily for successful implementation of SAP product, including providing functional expertise, guidance, presentation, and instruction on SAP products to clients. Assists in the development of the overall project plan (scoping process) as well as individual work plans. Acts as liason with client for troubleshooting: investigates, analyses, and solves software problems. Analyzes and maps clients’ business requirements, processes and objectives; develops necessary product modifications to satisfy clients’ needs. Maintains/expands client list & builds credible relationships w/ clients, develops own professional learning of SAP products/technologies and solutions to both clients and fellow colleagues. Supports sales activities by identifying License and Services leads. Assists in internal activities - remote consulting, pre-sales, prepares training materials, teach on-site courses, participate in knowledge management/sharing and provide mentoring/support to less experienced colleagues, maintains necessary certifications.
Education and Required Work Experience: Bachelors Degree and 3
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to HR Direct (Americas: hrdirectamericas@sap.com, APJ: hrdirectapj@sap.com, EMEA: careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.
Additional Locations: No Selection Apply on Career Site

job.title: Mitarbeiter Empfang (m/w)
job.description:
Standort: Berlin
alfabet GmbH
Die alfabet GmbH ist Anbieter einer umfassenden Software-Lösung, die alle Aspekte des Business-IT-Managements abdeckt. alfabet bedient mit der Software-Suite Alfabet eine internationale Anwendergemeinschaft von mehr als 135 000 IT-, Finanz- und Business-Experten in über 40 Ländern. Zu den Kunden von alfabet zählen viele der Global-2000-Unternehmen, die sich über eine große Bandbreite von Branchen verteilen, vor allem die Finanz-, Automobil-, Telekommunikations-, Logistik- und High-Tech-Industrie.
Die alfabet GmbH wurde 1997 gegründet und ist seit Juni 2013 100prozentige Tochtergesellschaft der Software AG. Die Software AG ist der weltweit größte unabhängige Anbieter von Infrastruktursoftware für Geschäftsprozesse. Das Produktportfolio umfasst marktführende Lösungen für das Datenmanagement, die Erstellung und Modernisierung von Anwendungen, serviceorientierte Architekturen und die Optimierung von Geschäfts- prozessen. Die Software AG hat 40 Jahre internationale IT-Erfahrung und ist mit über 4.400 Mitarbeitern in 70 Ländern vertreten.
Unser Empfang ist die Visitenkarte unseres Unternehmens und stellt somit ein wichtiges Bindeglied zu unseren anspruchsvollen Kunden dar. Für diesen Bereich "General Services/ Facility Management" suchen wir einen Empfangsmitarbeiter (m/w) zur Unterstützung des Teams. In unserem global ausgerichteten Unternehmen erwarten Sie herausfordernde Aufgaben in einem kleinen dynamischen Team.
Ihre Aufgaben: eigenverantwortliches Management des Empfangsbereiches (Empfang, Begrüßung und Bewirtung von nationalen und internationalen Gästen und Kunden) erster Ansprechpartner am Telefon und Koordination von Gästen, Kunden, Dienstleistern und Mitarbeitern Schnittstelle zu verschiedenen Abteilungen Terminüberwachung und Koordination von Konferenz- und Meetingräumen Organisation Postsystem, d. h. Eingang, Verteilung, Frankierung, Ausgang bis hin zu Eildokumenten Bearbeitung anfallender administrativer Aufgaben
Ihr Profil: kaufmännischer Abschluss mit Berufserfahrungen ein gepflegtes Erscheinungsbild sowie souveränes und freundliches Auftreten und professionelle Umgangsformen service- und dienstleistungsorientiertes Denken und Handeln diplomatisches Geschick, ein ausgeprägtes Organisationstalent und Teamfähigkeit sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Sicherheit im Umgang mit dem PC und Microsoft Office-Produkten ein hohes Maß an Zuverlässigkeit, Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Flexibilität gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Interessiert? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen über unser Onlineverfahren. Ihre Bewerbung sollte ein kurzes Anschreiben, einen tabellarischen Lebenslauf und Ihre Ausbildungs- und Arbeitszeugnisse enthalten. Für Fragen zu dieser Stellenausschreibung steht Ihnen Frau Claudia Wernitz unter +49 30 880 345 215 oder per Email Claudia.Wernitz@softwareag.com gern zur Verfügung. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Lifeguard - Seasonal - Wyndham Shawnee Village Resort
job.description: 2015 Seasonal Lifeguard (Mid-May through Labor Day)The Lifeguardâ€™s primary responsibility is the safety of the owners and guests at the resort. This position is the first responder for any incident that may occur in the pool area(s). He/she will be required to provide medical attention or conduct a water rescue if necessary. In addition, the Lifeguard provides Count On Me service for the resortâ€™s owners and guests. As secondary responsibilities, the Lifeguard is responsible for communicating and assisting guests with their needs or inquiries, keeping the pool area(s) clean, organizing furniture, and providing towels to the guests. As part of the Activities Department, the Lifeguard may also be asked to assist in resort activities and events. Essential Job Functions Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 1. Monitor the pool and surrounding areas. Ensure that the pool area is safe and secure at all times. Communicate with guests to make them aware of the safety rules of the pool area(s). Provide medical attention and conduct water rescues if necessary. (80% time) 2. Assist with execution of resort activities and events. Set up and take down resort activities and events. Assists with organization and execution of activitiesâ€™ programs in the pool area. (10% time) 3. Attend resort and company trainings and meetings. Complete training and certifications as required by companyâ€™s standards. (5% time) 4. Performs other duties as needed (5% time)QualificationsMinimum Requirements and Qualifications a) Education - High school diploma or equivalent. b) Training requirements - Must be a certified lifeguard. Life Saving/Water Safety, CPR, First Aid Certification c) Knowledge and skills - Excellent communication skills - Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules and procedural manuals - Ability to write simple reports - Ability to use simple tracking systems - Ability to give high priority to customer service - Ability to solve problems with minimal additional guidance - Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision - Ability to demonstrate good judgment when dealing with guests and staff members - Create a positive work environment by maintaining the highest level of ethics, integrity, and safety consistent with applicable regulatory standards and Wyndham Vacation Ownership values. - Ability to work an adjusted work schedule, including evenings, weekend and holidays to meet resort operating demands d) Technical Skills - None e) Job experience - Valid Lifeguard Certification Required, plus 3 months of Lifeguard experience Unless there is a legal requirement, experience will be accepted for the education requirement. *Must be 18 years of age or older *Available to work a flexible schedule through the summer season: days, evenings, weekends and holidays *WVO requires the successful completion of a background check prior to employment Job: Hotel/Resort OperationsEmployee Status: Full TimeSchedule: VariableOrganization: Wyndham Hotels and ResortsJob Number: 1501882 Apply on Career Site

job.title: Android Developer
job.description: Who are we, and what are we looking for? YinzCam is the industry-leading mobile developer for sports-team apps in the United States, with clients in most major professional sports leagues such as the NFL, NBA, NHL, MLS, and even international clients such as the Australian National Rugby League. We are experiencing a period of significant growth in our business, and are looking to add more full-time Android developers. You will have the opportunity to work in a team of highly-skilled and experienced mobile developers to build and launch mobile apps that will be promoted by sports teams/stadiums as their official mobile app, and that will, therefore, be in the hands of millions of fans around the world. You will work closely with designers and back-end developers in a collaborative environment to develop compelling applications that provide real-time statistics and media content from official league and team source data feeds, while continuing to evolve and enhance application interfaces and improve user experience. You will also have the opportunity to innovate and explore new features such as gaming, augmented reality, etc. Perks You will have the opportunity to travel to stadiums/arenas around the country (and potentially overseas) to see how sports technology works behind the scenes. You will be exposed to the sports industry and all aspects of the company's business, including licensing, sales, advertising, revenue generation, etc. You will work in a company that invests significantly in the training of its personnel, with staff being routinely encouraged to attend professional-development and training conferences to hone and extend their skills. Benefits include competitive salaries and medical+dental insurance. Why are we hiring? We are currently expanding rapidly to take on even more clients, more teams/stadiums and more sports, including overseas, and we are looking to grow our mobile team by adding full-time Android developers to meet the demand for our products, and to bring even more innovations and features to our existing mobile offerings. Our company affords a close-knit entrepreneurial environment with every individual being exposed to, and having a tangible impact on, the company's business. Come join us, and you will be a part of developing the ultimate mobile experience for sports fans everywhere! At least 2 years' experience with Android programming Required API experience in intermediate to advanced UI, networking, multimedia Extensive knowledge of Android's resource system and experience developing for multiple screens, form factors, and densities Experience with RESTful web services using XML/JSON data formats Strong proficiency in Eclipse, ADT, command-line adb tools Experience with SVN, Git, or other version control systems Strong shell command-line and scripting skills Highly desirable: Experience with or exposure to a wide variety of Android APIs: e.g., location services, GCM, animations, gestures, in-app billing, etc. Knowledgeable in Android-specific memory optimization techniques, especially bitmap management Experience with Android WebView API, including JS interfaces Proficient with one or more scripting languages Have at least one app that you developed (or contributed substantially to) and released in Google Play Please send your resume and highlight Your overall technical skills and background Your relevant professional and academic experience Your mobile-app development skills (mention example projects, which APIs were primarily used, number of months of experience, etc.)

job.title: Resident Concierge
job.description: Walnut Capital is looking for a Part-Time or Full-time Resident Concierge for our Luxury Apartments throughout Pittsburgh. Our caring and attentive Resident Concierge will focus on providing our residents with the utmost level of hospitality. Walnut Capital offers a great opportunity for anyone interested in property management and customer service with one of Pittsburgh’s fastest growing real estate development companies. Duties Include: Responsible for handling all resident interactions with an award-winning attitude Handle any communication of service requests with maintenance team and resolve any complaints, if any, from residents Provide support to community’s marketing efforts through positive and friendly interaction with any and all prospects, residents, and contractors Log and organize all deliveries & packages sent to the property Monitor all activity in the front of the lobby and ensure the comforts of prospects and visitors while they wait to speak with a leasing agent Maintain reservation calendar for all communal spaces and assist with scheduling, planning and organizing resident activities and events if needed Accommodate special requests from residents whenever possible including but not limited to recommendations, directions, reservations, etc. for the residents Qualifications: 1 – 2 years of experience in the hospitality industry preferred Knowledgeable of local events, venues, restaurants, transportation, and any other Pittsburgh amenities Maintain the company’s image through organization, professionalism, and positivity Must possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Ability to quickly learn new software programs Strong initiative and desire to succeed in a fast paced environment and satisfy customer needs

job.title: PATIENT EXPERIENCE MANAGER
job.description: AFresh Approach To Great Results.Charlotte-based Compass Group North America is the leader in foodservice management and support services. By combining fresh ideas with the industry’s greatest talent, we continue to set the standards for food and service excellence. Our vision for success is a powerful one – to continue to rise above the competition in every aspect of our business – from leading-edge technology, to purchasing, to foodservice, to catering and vending, to facilities management and support services. That kind of commitment commands only the best, and it's our great people providing great service that generates our great results. In turn, it’s important to us that our talented employees be given the proper resources to achieve their fullest potential. Play a key role in our future success: Job Description: And, as a member of Compass Group North America, we want you to be as great as you can be. We empower our associates to direct their own future, keeping them confident that we support them every step of the way. As a result, our associates embody greatness through their actions, natural passion for quality, and a can-do attitude. Hospitality and healthcare experience preferable. 3-4 years experience in service-oriented operations. 2-year degree preferred. Good coaching and on the job training skills required. Excellent organizational skills and ability to multi-task essential. Great People. Great Service. job.title: Packer
job.description:
Build your career at ConAgra Foods. At ConAgra Foods, we make great food — everyday food — in extraordinary ways, which is why we’re creating meaningful career opportunities for the best and the brightest. Whether you’re a recent graduate or an experienced professional, ConAgra Foods provides extraordinary job opportunities for growth with competitive salaries and benefits in an exciting, fast-paced workplace. Job Summary:
Maintains production and sanitary conditions by removing product from conveyor, inspecting product, hand packing into cartons, and performing described duties.
Reporting Relationship:
This position reports to the Packing Room Supervisor. This position receives general supervision and works according to standards.
Essential Tasks:
Ensures that product is free from contamination by following rules of good manufacturing practices for disease control, personal practices, and uniform policy. Ensures product protection by checking package integrity for good seals, proper price, code date, tape color, and product quality according to standard procedures #16 and #17 of Hazard Analysis of Critical Control Points (HACCP). Ensures good manufacturing procedures by following housekeeping standards. Works in a team to pack product by assembling boxes, taking sealed bags of product off automated conveyor line, taping boxes and placing on skid; pull sealed cases off automated packaging lines; or filling kegs and placing lids on containers. Stack sealed cases on skids according to stacking procedures under product pallet patterns and diagrams. Recognizes problems; shuts down machine and/or alerts machine operator according to standard procedures. Collects overruns in tubs and caddie bags and dumps as necessary according to standard procedures. Prepares cases for use on the next shift by stickering information on the side of the box to include brand name, quantity in case, weight of gag, product type, if no salt, and UPC code from back of the bag. Ensures efficient and quality production and positive employee relations by complying with all employment policies, rules, regulations, safety procedures, good manufacturing procedures, product protection standards and actively participating in all training requirements.
Additional Tasks: Contributes to team effort by performing other assigned duties as needed. Maintains cooperative relationship with coworkers and management by communicating necessary information, responding to requests, building rapport; and participating in problem solving methods.
Job Qualifications Essential knowledge, skills, abilities and experience: Ability to keep up with fast-paced conveyor line. Mental alertness to identify quality issues. Ability to understand and follow standard procedures. Ability to identify words and numbers. Ability to work as a team player. Ability to notify machine operators or supervisor of production problems.
Physical demands and Work Conditions: Ability to work required shift, meet attendance requirements, and work overtime when required. Ability to stand for long periods of time with the exception of breaks when employee can sit down. Ability to walk short distances in an around packing area and around plant for general cleaning duties. Ability to twist and reach to grab bags for packing. Simple grasping is used to take product from conveyor and place in box, which is placed on tables off the floor for back protection. Ability to bend forward. Bending to the floor occurs when the employee is placing a box on the first layer of the skid. Ability to lift 35 lb. Product weight ranges from 1 lb. bags 21 oz. kegs with boxes ranging from 12lb. to 30lb. Overrun tubs weigh up to 35lb. Employees are rotated and team members increased for certain production jobs to decrease ergonomics effect. Ability to reach above shoulder height to stack boxes. Ability to twist caps onto pretzel kegs. Ability to distinguish colors for color-coded product tape. Ability to stoop to clean under equipment.
ConAgra Foods, Inc., is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Associate General Counsel
job.description:
Your success is a train ride away.Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country and we move America’s workforce toward the future. We employ more than 20,000 diverse, energetic professionals in a variety of career fields throughout the United States. The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority and the success of our railroad is the result of our employees.Are you ready to join our team? SUMMARY OF DUTIES:This position is responsible for providing legal advice and counsel on real estate matters and contract negotiation and drafting services primarily to Amtrak’s Real Estate Development function and other departments requiring real estate transaction support in connection with their work. Particular focus will be on structuring, documenting and negotiating real estate transactions, including acquisition and disposition of real property, retail, office and train station leases, ground leases, licenses and easement agreements, complex development projects, site development agreements, real estate management agreements, confidentiality and nondisclosure agreements and rights-of-entry.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:• Provides legal advice and counsel regarding real estate matters to the Corporation’s business leaders.• Provides legal support for structuring, documenting and negotiating real property transactions including those pertaining to land use, air rights, easements, retail leases, station leases, office leases, licenses, agreements of sale and property management as well as drafts contracts for such transactions.• Advises the Executive Vice President, Chief Legal Officer, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary, Vice President and Managing Deputy General Counsels, and executives in other departments, relative to legal considerations inherent in a variety of real estate matters in order to ensure that the Corporation makes business decisions with full knowledge of applicable legal considerations and potential risks.• Works and coordinates with clients and other Amtrak attorneys on a broad range of activities and functions to ensure effective operations and the achievement of the Corporation’s Strategic Plan and objectives.• Reviews and interprets legislation and regulations and becomes fully knowledgeable about federal statutes and regulations applicable to Amtrak, including the Corporation’s capabilities and constraints. • Where necessary, provides oversight and financial management of outside counsel, in accordance with Law Department guidelines.• Develops and conducts training seminars and other information programs for business leaders on topics such as commercial real estate purchase and sale agreements, leasing, financing, title insurance, zoning and land use.
WORK EXPERIENCE:• Demonstrated experience in a corporate, government or law firm environment.• Demonstrated experience in commercial real estate transactions, including acquisition, sale, leasing, development, financing, title insurance and surveys.• Ability to manage and direct a large caseload of varying complexity.• Ability to advise management on range of real estate matters, and experience in doing so.• Ability to draft and negotiate complex and diverse agreements including real estate contracts, leases, easements, purchase and sale agreements, construction contracts and development agreements, and experience in doing so.• Ability to respond to the business needs of both internal clients and external customers, and experience in doing so.• Ability to think, plan, organize and implement strategically, and experience in doing so.• Excellent analytical written and oral communication skills.• Ability to draft memoranda setting forth legal advice and other documents relating to corporate governance, including corporate policies, and experience in doing so.• Knowledge of providing, maintaining and updating of form or template contracts.• Ability to conduct training for business leaders on matters relating to transactions as well legal requirements of the company, and experience in doing so.
PREFERRED WORK EXPERIENCE:• A general understanding of environmental laws and regulations and how they impact real estate transactions is helpful.• A general understanding of the Americans with Disabilities Act and related laws and regulations and how they impact real estate transactions is helpful.• Prior experience with railroads or public transit entities is helpful.
COMMUNICATION AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills. Requisition ID:8741Posting Location(s):District of Columbia; PennsylvaniaJob Family/Function:Legal Relocation Offered:No Education Requirements:DoctorateTravel Requirements:Up to 25% Employment Experience Requirements:10 plus years of expAmtrak employees power our progress through their performance.We want your work at Amtrak to be more than a job – we want it to be a fulfilling experience where you find challenging and rewarding opportunities, respect among colleagues, competitive pay, benefits that protect you and your family, and a high performance culture that recognizes and values your contributions and helps you reach your career goals.We proudly support and encourage U.S. Veterans to apply for Amtrak job opportunities.All positions require pre-employment background verification, medical review and pre-employment drug screen. job.title: Tool & Die Mechanic
job.description:
. Armstrong World Industries, Inc. is seeking experienced Tool & Die Mechanics to effectively maintain tooling and dies in a manner that contributes to the continuous improvement of our Lancaster, PA plants' manufacturing processes and overall performance.
Primary responsibilities include but, are not limited to; PM, repair, and rebuild (assembly) of tooling & dies to specifications and SOP requirements. Fabricate, PM, repair, and rebuild cutting tools, jigs, fixtures and gauges as per specifications. General machinist work to product precision parts for tooling & dies as well as other plant equipment. Investigate, analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve tooling and die issues. Coordinate tooling and die PM, repair, and rebuilds with the production team. Proactively seeks opportunities to improve tooling and die performance. Actively work with the production, maintenance, and engineering teams to improve the tooling & die PM, repair, and rebuild process. Follow up on each tooling & die PM, repair, and rebuild to ensure effectiveness. Engage operators routinely to ensure tooling & dies are performing to specifications. Assist in managing cost controls related to tooling & die PM, repairs, and rebuilds. Maintain documentation, records, and logs for all tooling and dies. Help determine stocking levels of tooling and die rebuild components. Maintain 5S standards in the die and machine shop areas. Maintain company and personal tools and equipment as required. Participate in 5S and lean activities when requested. Perform other duties as required to maintain or improve plant reliability. Conduct daily safety risk assessments on routine and non-routine job tasks. Educate production and maintenance team members on tooling and die operations and maintenance. Provide training to these groups as needed. As required respond to calls on off shifts, weekends, and holidays.
Required Qualifications; Minimum of 8 years experience working as a Tool & Die Mechanic in a fast pace manufacturing environment Ability to machine and work at close tolerances Proficient use of machining equipment (mills, lathes, drills, grinder, etc) Welding, torching, and fabrication of all types of materials at different thicknesses Use precision measuring instruments and tools Comprehend blueprints, assembly drawings, and equipment manuals Strong troubleshooting and root cause analysis skills Strong math skills Able to work independent of direct supervision, demonstrate strong communications skills as well as strong interpersonal and team skills. Proven ability to work in a safe manner as well as follow safe work practices and plant policies. Ability to work all shifts and respond for emergency calls on off hours, weekends, and holidays. This position will have a given schedule either 7am-3pm or 3pm-11pm, but it will be important that the incumbent can be flexible with their time when the needs arise. Able to operate all types of mobile equipment utilized in performing maintenance related tasks. Able to lift up to 50 lbs. Preferred Qualifications; Familiar with SAP work order and inventory control packages. Familiar with Microsoft Office software package. Benefits offered by Armstrong World Industries: Armstrong offers competitive benefits including medical, dental, prescription drugs, life insurance, long term disability coverage, vacation and product discount programs. About Armstrong World Industries: Established in 1860, Armstrong World Industries, Inc. is a multi-billion dollar global leader in the design and manufacture of floors and ceilings with a focus on innovation, design, and environmental sustainability. Based in Lancaster PA, Armstrong serves both the residential and commercial markets operating plants and distribution centers in eight countries with over 9,000 employees worldwide. About the Location (Lancaster, PA): Located in the heart of Pennsylvania Dutch Country, Lancaster is ideally situated for easy access to major metropolitan cities such as Philadelphia, Baltimore, Washington DC and New York City. Lancaster offers a vibrant arts and entertainment community with wonderful historic sites, B&Bs, museums, world class shopping, entertainment venues and restaurants.How to Apply:Armstrong is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disabled/Vets. Apply online at http://careers.armstrong.com/Req ID: [[id]] Job: Manufacturing Primary Location: Lancaster, PennsylvaniaOther Locations: Employment Status: Full-TimeTravel: No Selection Notice to Staffing Agencies, Placement Services, and Professional Recruiters Armstrong World Industries, Inc. has an internal Staffing Department. Recruiters are hereby specifically directed NOT to contact Armstrong employees directly in an attempt to present candidates. Armstrong will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to Armstrong, including unsolicited resumes sent to an Armstrong mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to Armstrong employees, or to Armstrong’s resume database will be considered Armstrong property. Armstrong will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Armstrong will consider any candidate for whom a Recruiter has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Recruiter free of any charges or fees. Armstrong will not pay a fee to any Recruiter that does not have a signed Armstrong contract in place specific to the position for which the resume was submitted. Recruiting vendor agreements will only be valid if in writing and signed by Armstrong’s Corporate Talent Acquisition Manager or his or her designee. No other Armstrong employee is authorized to bind Armstrong to any agreement regarding the placement of candidates by Recruiters. job.title: Integrated Communications Sr Specialist
job.description:
Requisition ID: 51498Work Area: Communication ConsultingExpected Travel: 0 - 10%Career Status: ProfessionalEmployment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
As market leader in enterprise application software, SAP helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. From the back office to the boardroom, warehouse to storefront, on premise to cloud, desktop to mobile device – SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively to stay ahead of the competition. SAP applications and services enable customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES: SAP's Global Communications (GC) unit is charged with protecting and enhancing the reputation of SAP among internal and external audiences. To that end, GC strives to position SAP as the world’s leading business software solution provider, recognized thought leader, responsible corporate citizen, as well as employer, business partner, vendor, and investment of choice. In addition the communications function supports sales of SAP software solutions and products, informs employees about strategy, performance and execution and drives employee engagement. GC programs are in principle geared towards influencing SAP’s primary audiences -- customers, partners, investors, government officials, (potential) employees -- either … • indirectly via influencers such as Media (print, online, broadcast), Bloggers, Industry Analysts or • directly as in the case of our communication with employees, managers and government representatives. “Customers” of SAP’s communications function are therefore both the internal stakeholders representing SAP’s business, our employees, and the relevant external influencers. In that context, the Integrated Communications functions within Global Communications are responsible for planning and driving the execution of communications activities across these multiple audiences. Integrated communications functions within GC exist on the global, regional, and local levels.
EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS: The Senior Specialist in this function …. - Leads a virtual global, regional or local team that is responsible for a selection of the below dimensions of managing communications programs and channels. and/or for individual projects within GC communications programs.- The Senior Specialist level of Integrated Communications covers all or a selection of GC’s communications objectives or programs.- At the Senior Specialist level this job includes hands-on media relations and/or employee communications responsibilities (building channels, creating and sharing content, and reaching out to audiences).
Dimensions of managing communications programs and channels: - Aligning and Focusing - Deriving key communications objectives and strategies from business objectives and strategies in consultation with internal stakeholders- Building communications messages and selecting communications topics to focus on Planning and Resourcing - Defining communications activities against key communications objectives, strategies, and programs- Identifying related cost and required bandwidth- Managing budgets- Aligning audience needs with appropriate content formats and channels Planning and Resourcing - Defining communications activities against key communications objectives, strategies, and programs- Identifying related cost and required bandwidth- Managing budgets- Aligning audience needs with appropriate content formats and channels
Getting people ready - Evaluate and deploy technology and best practices to support integrated and collaborative communications planning and execution across the global communications function.
Orchestrating the Execution of Communications Programs - Ensure the integrated execution of communication programs (building channels, creating and sharing content, and reaching out to audiences)- Ensuring alignment, high impact, synergies and reuse.- Develop and implement related processes- Develop, implement, and manage efficient communications channels
Monitoring and Adjusting - Tracking execution of plan- Conducting measurements- Collecting feedback from target audiences- Gauging satisfaction of stakeholders- Channel the results of measurements as well as other outside-in intelligence (incl. media coverage analysis) from constituency groups into the processes for building the SAP business strategy and the GC communications strategy.- Reviewing and analyzing impact- Adjusting plans and content
WORK EXPERIENCE: - Experience in hands-on design and implementation of communications concepts and plans- Experience in communications to more than one influencer type (media, bloggers, analyst, governments officials, employee communications) is a plus- Experienced in handling confidential material

job.title: keyholder associate
job.description:
Company Name: Turkey HillPosition Type: EmployeeFLSA Status: Non-Exempt
Responsible for assisting the Store Manager in managing and directing the efficient operation of assigned store to maximize sales and profitability. Perform the duties of the Store Manager in his/her absence. Role model and demonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety of others. Essential Job Functions: Assist the Store Manager in recruiting, selecting, and managing a team of sales oriented associates who perform at levels consistent with our corporate objectives. Certify training emphasizing correct POS procedures, exceptional customer service, and plus selling. Support, uphold, and enforce all Company policies, and local, state, and federal laws and regulations. Assist in the management of labor and scheduling to minimize labor expenses, while ensuring adequate store staffing in accordance with the Labor Scheduling Program. Recognize the cause of shrink and works effectively to control losses and helps to increase profits. Assist in ordering merchandise and supplies to maintain appropriate inventory levels and maximize sales without merchandise out of stocks. Correctly verify the delivery of all merchandise and insure that all employees do the same. Ensure that the correct pricing is maintained and that all merchandise is in-code and saleable. Maintains high standards of store image ensuring that the store is clean, well-stocked, and ready for business. Strive to increase sales through suggestive selling skills/techniques and to consistently improve customer service. Ensure information flows to all Store Associates and advises management of significant events affecting the store. Supervise and coach direct reports in the performance of their duties; complete performance reviews and provides feedback to direct reports. Must be able to perform the essential functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation. Minimum Position Qualifications: 2-3 years experience working in a retail setting and/or has successfully completed the training program for Store Assistant Manager. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Must correctly demonstrate all Store Associate duties and be able to efficiently manage all store activities in the absence of the Store Manager. Most stores are open seven days a week and 24 hours per day. The Assistant Manager is scheduled to work various shifts, including weekends and holidays, as required to ensure the store is adequately staffed. Must be available to work overtime as needed. Must have reliable source of transportation and the ability to be reached 24 hours a day 7 days a week. Desired Previous Job Experience 2 years retail management experience or 2 years non-retail management experience. Associates or Bachelor's Degree. Proficient computer skills.
Education Level: NoneRequired Certifications/Licenses: NonePosition Type: Full-Time Shift(s): Day; Evening; OvernightRegions: Any; General Office- Cincinnati; Mid-Atlantic; Midwest; Mountain; South; West States: PennsylvaniaKeywords:
Turkey Hill Minit Markets Jobs: Turkey Hill Minit Markets is always looking for exceptional Associates to work in our convenience stores and at our corporate office in Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We offer competitive wages and benefits, a flexible schedule and room for career advancement. If you're interested in a job opportunity with Turkey Hill Minit Markets, we welcome you to complete an online application today.
Company OverviewKroger, one of the world's largest retailers, employs more than 368,000 associates who serve customers in 2,641 supermarkets and multi-department stores in 34 states and the District of Columbia under two dozen local banner names including Kroger, City Market, Dillons, Food 4 Less, Fred Meyer, Fry's, Harris Teeter, Jay C, King Soopers, QFC, Ralphs and Smith's. The company also operates 786 convenience stores, 327 fine jewelry stores, 1,218 supermarket fuel centers and 38 food processing plants in the U.S. Recognized by Forbes as the most generous company in America, Kroger supports hunger relief, breast cancer awareness, the military and their families, and more than 30,000 schools and grassroots organizations. Kroger contributes food and funds equal to 200 million meals a year through more than 80 Feeding America food bank partners. A leader in supplier diversity, Kroger is a proud member of the Billion Dollar Roundtable and the U.S. Hispanic Chamber's Million Dollar Club.

job.title: Solution Expert
job.description:
Requisition ID: 37225Work Area: Software-Design and DevelopmentExpected Travel: 0 - 50%Career Status: ProfessionalEmployment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
As market leader in enterprise application software, SAP helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. From the back office to the boardroom, warehouse to storefront, on premise to cloud, desktop to mobile device – SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively to stay ahead of the competition. SAP applications and services enable customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES
SAP Custom Development is a global organization dedicated to delivering solutions that addresses market specific or customers’ unique and competitive business requirements. The mission of SAP Custom Development is to be agile, innovative and flexible in providing high quality, supportable solutions. With 11 development centers worldwide, we are able to leverage a global delivery model that utilizes the specific strengths of each location.
As the global business development team we are expected to support the 4 regions (North America, Latin America, Europe and Asia Pacific & Japan) throughout the whole CD sales process from lead generation until successful delivery of a custom-developed project (CDP), or a packaged solution, and during a support phase.
SAP Custom Development therefore looks for an engaged seasoned professional (f/m) in the role of a Global Solution Architect (Expert level). The candidate must have a strong development or consulting background with proven experience on multiple customer projects within the hybris or CRM space. The candidate should have a very charismatic personality with superb presentation skills geared to all levels of customer’s corporate structure from IT developers to high executive level.
EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
As a Solution Architect for Custom Development you will: Analyze the requirements coming from leading companies Work closely together with customers and internal SAP teams (such as Go-To-Market, Consulting, Business Development, Sales, Development) Develop Go-To-Market approaches for new markets/products and plan/execute respective activities, such as presentations at industry events Position our solution experience with new and existing customers (Business Development/Market Development) Discuss with customers different architecture approaches, considering commercial implications for SAP Perform effort estimations for projects to be won Write Solution Proposals for projects to be won Take ownership of large portions of a project deal, including the analysis, authoring and estimation of a solution.
As a Solution Architect, you are expected to optimize the customer’s project by ensuring maximized usage of the SAP Standard Product and proposing a custom solution that is sustainable and maintainable. In the early stages of qualification and engagement, a Solution Architect must possess the ability to rapidly develop solution concepts, an overall vision of the “art-of-the-possible”. During formal evaluations, a Solution Architect acts as the team lead, must closely collaborate with Development Architects, delegate ownership and responsibility for various solution elements to the Development Architects, facilitates interaction and collaboration with the customer and acts as the “primary voice” of the team to the account team and the customer.
EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Software architecture and development experience In-depth knowledge of and tangible project experience with hybris commerce suite and/or SAP CRM Industry knowledge (in particular retail, wholesale, automotive or telco) is a plus. Strong analytical and communication skills, including ability to rapidly gather data, structure hypotheses, and develop synthesized findings/recommendations Preferably some presales experience Ability to pick up knowledge in new areas very fast Fluent business German, in speaking and writing Fluent business English, in speaking and writing Strong team orientation and ability to thrive on virtual, international, cross-functional teams Proven record of excellent performance Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or related fields Excellent verbal, communication and board/executive level presentation skills. Act pro-actively and success-driven, with a “can do” attitude Bring the ability to understand and explain complex technical environments, at the same time reducing complexity Show strong leadership and coaching skills Innovative and willing to leave old paths behind
WORK EXPERIENCE
Minimum 5-8 years professional experience Managed customer relationship over an extended period Deep understanding of overall SAP portfolio Experience in solving customer issues and building solution proposals.
LOCATION
North America (Philadelphia, Palo Alto, Montreal)
EXPECTED TRAVEL
Travel Expectations: 50%
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to HR Direct (Americas: hrdirectamericas@sap.com, APJ: hrdirectapj@sap.com, EMEA: careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.
Additional Locations: No Selection Apply on Career Site

job.title: Product Director (1 of 5)
job.description: Johnson & Johnson companies are equal opportunity employers. Product Director (1 of 5)-3833150409DescriptionDePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Product Director in West Chester, PA.DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is the largest, most innovative and comprehensive orthopaedic and neurological business in the world. DePuy Synthes Companies offer an unparalleled breadth and depth of products, services and programs in the areas of joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neurological, craniomaxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials. Building on the legacy and strengths of two great companies, more agile and better equipped to meet the needs of today’s evolving health care environment. With a focus on activating insights to develop innovative, comprehensive solutions, we are inspired to advance patient care in greater ways than either company could accomplish on its own.Synthes Trauma is the worldwide leader in the development of products to treat orthopaedic trauma and other bone deformities. The company is headquartered in West Chester, PA and Solothurn, Switzerland and employs over 1,000 people worldwide. This position is responsible for the worldwide marketing of products within one of the company’s anatomic business units (Hip & Pelvis, Knee, Platform Technologies, Hand & Wrist, Shoulder & Elbow, or Foot & Ankle).Various functions of the Product Director include driving commercial results, developing brand strategies, identifying customer insights, developing and executing business plans, portfolio management, product development, product launches and general business support.The Product Director will report to either a Senior Product Director or World Wide Group Product Director.Responsibilities of the Product Director include but are not limited to:Commercial Results - Achieve worldwide business plan objectives of sales, net income, gross profit, inventory and price on an annual basis. Manage expenses within budget. Increase company’s leadership position in trauma market. Development and execute strategies to protect and grow company’s #1 position in the worldwide Plate and Screw market and develop a leadership position in the worldwide Intramedullary Nail market.People Management - Position typically does not involve management of direct reports, but will provide direction and mentorship to junior members of the team.Brand Strategy - Contribute to the development of global brand strategies for products, services, programs and other key initiatives including establishment of value proposition, targeting & segmentation, positioning, global branding, and lifecycle management. Manages lifecycle of product portfolio. Provides input into next generation portfolio prioritization. Manage the removal of products from market (obsolescence).Customer Insights and Analytics - Partner with Strategic Marketing to execute market research initiatives around customer needs and product validation. Provide technical expertise to assist in their execution. Stay connected with market needs through frequent interaction with customers (co-travel with sales consultants, attendance at industry meetings, review medical journals, etc.)Business Planning & Execution - Work closely with manager to develop business plans related to area of focus (i.e. business segment, product, region, etc.). Collaborate with other functional areas to execute plan. Apply understanding of the sales process to develop well positioned market messaging that can drive customer behavior. Partner with the sales force and field marketing to effectively deploy.Portfolio Planning & Product Development - Contribute to multigenerational portfolio plans aligned to company strategy. Partner with R&D counterpart to lead product development programs. Responsible for contributing to product scope, providing design inputs, validating product design, and development of launch messaging and materials, set configurations, etc. Leverage strong understanding of product development process and functional areas (quality, regulatory, etc.) to ensure on-time launches.Product Launch - Responsible for leading and executing impactful worldwide product launches. Specific responsibilities include the development of brand strategy, marketing materials for all key stakeholders (salesforce, surgeons, hospitals, patients, payers, etc.), price strategy, promotional plan, product training plan (salesforce & surgeons), product forecasting, inventory roll-out plan, sales tools, etc. Lead coordination with Stakeholder and Regional Marketing teams.General Business Support - Develop strong relationships with surgeon customers and key targets. Partner with Professional Education & Tradeshow groups to build promotional plans around key events and provide on-site support. Partner closely with Regional Marketing and Sales Teams to gather input on customer needs and ensure strong alignment with product and company strategy. Be responsive in responding to requests from customers and sales consultants. Work collaboratively with other functional areas to ensure business issues are addressed.Approximately 40% travel including weekends. Travel includes both domestic and international travel.QualificationsA minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree is required. An MBA is preferred. A minimum of 5 years progressive business experience in any of the following areas: Marketing, Medical Device Product Development R&D, Medical Device Sales, or a combination of sales and Marketing is required. A minimum of 2 years of experience in medical device or other healthcare regulated environment is required. The successful incumbent must have experience developing and executing successful business plans. Prior experience managing medical device product lines, including leading product development teams and setting strategic direction for product portfolio is preferred.Experience in developing and launching new products, services and programs to the healthcare community is required. Experience interacting with key surgeon customers and sales force is preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills are required. The selected candidate must have the ability to work in a hand’s –on, fast paced, customer focused environment. World Wide experience is preferred.This position requires approximately 40% travel including weekends. Travel includes both domestic and international travel. English speaking is required. Fluency in Swiss-German or German is preferred.BE VITAL in your Career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of CompaniesJ2W: LI NAPrimary Location:North America-United States-Pennsylvania-West ChesterOrganization: Depuy Orthopaedics. Inc. (6029)Job Function: Product ManagementCertain sites within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies participate in E-Verify as appropriate in accordance with Company guidelines and federal or state law. (10% time) Performs other duties as needed. Excellent communication skills. Acquires job skills and learns company policies and procedures to complete routine tasks. Must maintain a professional appearance and a Can-Do, positive attitude towards all guests and staff. Ability to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment. Must be people oriented and able to work independently or with others as needed. Must be detail oriented. d) Technical Skills PC Skills and Knowledge Ability to use basic office equipment including Fax, copier, printers Microsoft Office: Word, excel, outlook Key systems Hotel Hospitality Front office system knowledge a plus Must be able to easily and frequently change from one activity to another while operating a switchboard or computer keyboard e) Job experience 1 year of guest services experience in a hospitality/hotel/resort environment and/or 1 year of customer service experience in service or retail environment Unless there is a legal requirement, experience will be accepted for the education requirement. *Must be 18 years of age or older to apply*Available to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends and holidays*WVO requires the successful completion of a background check prior to employment Job: Hotel/Resort Operations-Guest ServicesEmployee Status: Full TimeSchedule: VariableOrganization: Wyndham Vacation ResortsJob Number: 1501884 Apply on Career Site

job.title: Vice President Aftermarket Sales Americas
job.description:
Vice President Aftermarket Sales AmericasYork Preferred, but will consider others
SUMMARY: Manages Aftersales and Technical Services strategy for South, Central and North America. This position is responsible to create, implement and manage aftermarket strategies associated with customer satisfaction, aftermarket value added, service sales growth and series engineering/quality support.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: To create and implement “Best in Class” service strategies for the Americas covering repairs, rebuilds and spare parts for the CV group; evaluates, adjusts, or redrafts the these action plans accordingly to meet current and future customer needs.
To create and actively track aftermarket KPIs and implement changes as required to meet or exceed business objective.
Provide guidance to Operations, Supply Chain and Workshops to make sure that customer service and aftermarket expectations are met.
Identify opportunities for continued growth in the Aftermarket service business through both organic and inorganic means.
Continuous evaluation of the Regional service centers footprints and rightsizing to address future growth or business needs.
Identify opportunities and creates proposals to increase aftermarket value added concepts for CV products.
Create, negotiate and manage third party service contracts for the servicing of Voith CV products.
Insure that the Regional Field Service Groups are properly trained and tooled to perform service work.
Responsible for the technical coordination between the Regions and the CV Group in Germany as it pertains to service and quality issues, documentation and production issues.
Build and maintain contact and close relationships with key aftermarket customers in the Regions.
Provide regional guidance; manage talent and succession planning; identify and coach high potentials.
Provide input to Business Development on regional aftermarket development for CV.
Other tasks as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS: EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE
Degree from a four-year college or university;
5 years related experience in the automotive, agricultural field focused on service and parts;
Or equivalent combination of education and experience
SKILLS REQUIRED
Experience with MS Office product line to include Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel and Word
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written
Excellent organizational skills demonstrating an ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple projects and independent tasks

job.title: Part time Store QSR Clerk
job.description:
Company Name: Turkey HillPosition Type: EmployeeFLSA Status: Non-Exempt
Position Summary:Responsible for providing superior customer service under the guidelines of the company policies and all applicable laws. Strive to maximize sales through suggestive selling techniques/skills, and accurate recording of sales. Role model and demonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety of others. Essential Job Functions: Prioritize customer service ahead of other tasks and ensures that each customer receives prompt and courteous service. Suggestive sells to each customer by pointing out specials and suggesting related or alternative items to assist customers and to help the store improve merchandise sales. Supports the Company Vision and Mission Statements and performs the strategies necessary to achieve them. Display positive, professional conduct at all times. Treat customers and fellow associates with respect and consideration. Cooperatively and enthusiastically works with manager and co-workers. Operate the POS and other sales equipment within company guidelines for cash and shrink control, including keying correct sales amounts into the correct department, counting back, change, offering receipt, and thanking customers for their business. Uphold all company policies, as well as local, state, and federal regulations. Requires valid identification of any alcohol or tobacco customer who appears to be 30 years of age or younger. Maintain cash in drawers at or below maximum amounts by correctly recording and dropping into the safe. Check and reconcile POS equipment, safe, and gas console (where applicable) at end of each shift and correctly completes shift reports. Immediately reports any theft or suspicion of theft to Store Manager or District Advisor. Perform shift duties including continually cleaning fast food areas, floors, counters, equipment, shelves, bathrooms, gasoline equipment, and grounds as assigned. Receive, price, stock, and rotate merchandise as per instruction. Front and face shelves, racks, coolers and freezers. Prepare fast food products,including coffee, hot dogs, etc. and keeps them freshly available. Date codes fast food items when stocking and removes out-of-date merchandise. Confirm that all supplies required for customer service excellence are stocked (for example; napkins, cups, straws, lids, ice, condiments, and windshield fluid and paper towels at the gas island). Understand emergency (employee or customer injury, gas spill, fire, or other accidents), robbery, shoplifting, and drive-off procedures. Appropriately completes Incident or Injury reports as instructed. Maintain high standards of food safety to ensure food is maintained at proper time and temperature by regularly monitoring and documenting as required. Must be able to perform the essential functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation.
Minimum Position Qualifications: While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Must be available to work all hours as assigned including but not limited to early morning or evening hours that may include overtime. Desired Previous Job Experience A high school diploma (or equivalent) or related retail experience is required. College helpful Proficient computer skills Current Food Safety Certification
Education Level: NoneRequired Certifications/Licenses: NonePosition Type: Part-Time Shift(s): Day; Evening; OvernightRegions: Any States: PennsylvaniaKeywords:
Turkey Hill Minit Markets Jobs: Turkey Hill Minit Markets is always looking for exceptional Associates to work in our convenience stores and at our corporate office in Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We offer competitive wages and benefits, a flexible schedule and room for career advancement. If you're interested in a job opportunity with Turkey Hill Minit Markets, we welcome you to complete an online application today.
Company OverviewKroger, one of the world's largest retailers, employs more than 368,000 associates who serve customers in 2,641 supermarkets and multi-department stores in 34 states and the District of Columbia under two dozen local banner names including Kroger, City Market, Dillons, Food 4 Less, Fred Meyer, Fry's, Harris Teeter, Jay C, King Soopers, QFC, Ralphs and Smith's. The company also operates 786 convenience stores, 327 fine jewelry stores, 1,218 supermarket fuel centers and 38 food processing plants in the U.S. Recognized by Forbes as the most generous company in America, Kroger supports hunger relief, breast cancer awareness, the military and their families, and more than 30,000 schools and grassroots organizations. Kroger contributes food and funds equal to 200 million meals a year through more than 80 Feeding America food bank partners. A leader in supplier diversity, Kroger is a proud member of the Billion Dollar Roundtable and the U.S. Hispanic Chamber's Million Dollar Club.
