job.title: CIP Specialist
job.description: Returning Candidate?Log back in!CIP SpecialistReq ID: 2015-14950Location Name: NRG Homer City ServicesCategory: OperationsState/City: US-PA-Homer CityType: Full-Time Salary# Openings: 1Details About this Career Opportunity:Overview:Company Profile:NRG is at the forefront of changing how people think about and use energy. We deliver cleaner and smarter energy choices for our customers, backed by the nation’s largest independent power generation portfolio of fossil fuel, nuclear, solar and wind facilities. A Fortune 500 company, NRG is challenging the U.S. energy industry by becoming the largest developer of solar power, building the first privately-funded electric vehicle charging infrastructure, and providing customers with the most advanced smart energy solutions to better manage their energy use. In addition to 47,000 megawatts of generation capacity, enough to supply nearly 40 million homes, our retail electricity providers – Reliant, Green Mountain Energy and Energy Plus – serve more than two million customers. More information is available at www.nrgenergy.com. Connect with NRG Energy on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.Responsibilities:Responsible for overseeing the specific critical asset cyber security compliance program to the NERC Critical Infrastructure Protection standards for the affected critical site (s). Primary responsibilities include:- Working independently, perform all site/application specific activities, tests and controls (i.e. Catsweb controls) for meeting program requirements and ongoing compliance- Maintain site/application documentation, information protection and procedures to support physical and electronic security plans- Participate in Cyber Vulnerability Assessments and activities to mitigate compliance issues in accordance with CIP requirements- Reconcile discrepancies between documented lists and system generated reports of system access- Serve as point of contact for controlling and documenting access to protected assets, information, and environments and perform cyber assessments and activities and assessments in accordance with CIP requirements- For new sites in region, develop and/or assist in creation of work scope, design of Cyber Security configuration around systems, implementation and training at site, benchmarking and commissioning- Grant and revoke electronic access to site control systems and related sensitive information, according to established policies and processes- Grant and revoke physical access to restricted, access-controlled areas, according to established policies and processes- Own and maintain updates to documentation records as they relate to lists of authorized personnel- Execute, manage and maintain appropriate controls for physical access and electronic access for control devices- Assist Regional CIP Manager in preparation for various audits and act as SME for site/application. Develop recommendations, responses and remediation plans in response to audit findings- Perform activities for information protection, account management and configuration and procedures to support physical and electronic security plans and maintain site documentation- Perform necessary patch assessment for region, site or system, malware and antivirus updates and backups as required using appropriate change control methods.- Conduct periodic maintenance of physical perimeters in accordance with site physical plans- Monitor physical and electronic perimeters for potential breaches and act as first responder for any potential breach or incident- Respond to any potential breach and conduct recovery and backup effort as necessary- Perform required incident response, recovery and backup tests with sites- Work with Regional CIP Manager, Corporate Security and IT to perform periodic review as well as revise structure of security configuration based upon changes in regulations- Perform necessary testing and assessments in conjunction with Regional CIP Manager and IT- Analyze cyber vulnerability assessments, develop and implement corrective action plans- Serve as primary SME on site specific hardware, software and control architectures, research and recommend new products and utilize best practices and knowledge of internal/external issues to improve or provide technical or compliance solutions.- Work with vendors to ensure solutions deployed are compliant to regulations and in alignment with corporate standards- Identify CCAs requiring TFEs for devices under responsibility- Escalate any potential violations or near misses for consideration as self-reports- Participate in all computer or network related design discussions at each facility/group management to ensure alignment with corporate standards and compliance to regulations.- Report progress on cyber security efforts to facility/group management and coordinate activities with the site- Identify new items for cyber security improvements and needs for budget development at sites with Critical Cyber AssetsQualifications:- At least 5-8 years experience in an industrial controls environment (power plant/energy, manufacturing, utility, or equivalent) with working knowledge of SCADA/DCS systems and related hardware and software.- Familiarization with network infrastructure threats or virus, intrusion containment and mitigation techniques.- Working knowledge of basic security and networking concepts including: LAN/WAN, firewalls, routers and switches, VPN, encryption, IDS/IPS sensors a plus.Demonstrated ability to work independently and as a team member.- Demonstrated ability to set priorities and to respond to changing demands from multiple sources.- Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in applying established techniques, procedures or standards; demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality.- Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills.- Ability to respond to issues and concerns 24 hours a day; ability to work additional hours.- Experience in regulatory audits is a plus.- Experience with NERC Critical Infrastructure Protection standards is a big plus.NRG Energy is committed to a drug and alcohol free workplace. To the extent permitted by law and any applicable collective bargaining agreement, employees are subject to periodic random drug testing, and post-accident and reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing.NRG Energy is an Equal Opportunity EmployerTitle/Salary Commensurate on ExperienceOfficial description on file with Human ResourcesInterested in this opportunity?- Apply online now!Apply for this job onlineRefer a friend to this jobGo back to the welcome pageApplication FAQsSoftware Powered by iCIMSwww.icims.com Apply on Career Site

job.title: Senior Functional Sales & Distribution Consultant
job.description:
Requisition ID: 51301Work Area: Consulting and Professional ServicesExpected Travel: 0 - 10%Career Status: ProfessionalEmployment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
As market leader in enterprise application software, SAP helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. From the back office to the boardroom, warehouse to storefront, on premise to cloud, desktop to mobile device – SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively to stay ahead of the competition. SAP applications and services enable customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES: The Senior Functional SD Consultant facilitates the implementation and support of SAP products to enhance the clients’ business functionality and overall performance, while maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction. 6-8 years professional Order to Cash business experience w/ a minimum of 4 full years of SAP product/implementation experience and/or 5+ years of SAP Sales & Distribution (SD) application/implementation experience required. Must have experienced leading a small group of functional SD consultants on at least 1 project. Strong understanding of SAP, its products and solutions, partners, markets and competition. Consultant should have the capability of effectively interacting with and presenting to appropriate levels of the client organization in formal presentations and informal discussions. Strong interpersonal and presentation skills. SAP project experience across ECC with an understanding of all SD components including pricing, order management, shipping and billing along with integration knowledge to MM, PP and FI/CO.
Position Duties and Responsibilities: Responsible primarily for successful implementation of SAP product, including providing functional expertise, guidance, presentation, and instruction on SAP products to clients. Assists in the development of the overall project plan (scoping process) as well as individual work plans. Acts as liason with client for troubleshooting: investigates, analyses, and solves software problems. Potentially lead a small team of SD functional consultants. Analyzes and maps clients’ business requirements, processes and objectives; develops necessary product modifications to satisfy clients’ needs. Maintains/expands client list & builds credible relationships w/ clients, develops own professional learning of SAP products/technologies and solutions to both clients and fellow colleagues. Supports sales activities by identifying License and Services leads. Assists in internal activities - remote consulting, pre-sales, prepares training materials, teach on-site courses, participate in knowledge management/sharing and provide mentoring/support to less experienced colleagues, maintains necessary certifications.
Education and Required Work Experience: Bachelors degree and 5+ years of directly related experience
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to HR Direct (Americas: hrdirectamericas@sap.com, APJ: hrdirectapj@sap.com, EMEA: careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.
Additional Locations: No Selection Apply on Career Site

job.title: Hospice Nurse - RN Admissions
job.description: Job ID: 5527Seasons Hospice & Palliative Care is seeking a Hospice Nurse Registered Nurse (RN) Admissions to join our team of professionals. We make a difference every day to patients and families coping with end of life illness in creating a center of excellence in hospice care.As a reflection of Seasons Hospice Admission policies, the Hospice Nurse - RN Admissions performs pre-admission evaluations for appropriateness for hospice services. Initiates the admission process by educating and informing patient/family of hospice and its services. Also obtains informed consents. Provides nursing assessment, initial plan of care and intervention(s) that optimize patient and family directed comfort and quality of life. The Hospice Nurse - RN Admissions will also be a member of the Hospice Care Consultant Team.QUALIFICATIONS:Registered Nurse currently licensed in the state(s).Minimum one year work experience in hospice, home health, geriatrics or general medical surgical nursing.Demonstrated commitment to Seasons Hospice s philosophy of care, values, mission statement and organizational cultureWillingness to work a flex schedule of 40 hours a week and serve patients/families in the geographic service area.Detail oriented with good time management skills.Above average documentation skills.Management/leadership skills required.NC1, BD3 Apply on Career Site

job.title: Seasonal Sales Associate – Limerick, PA (Philadelphia)
job.description:
THE RUNDOWN The Sales Associate is the most critical link in ensuring that our customers have a rewarding experience that will keep them coming back time after time. The Sales Associate must demonstrate excellent customer service skills, meet hourly selling and customer capture goals, provide product knowledge to our customers and work as part of a team to meet individual and store objectives.
THE ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS At Oakley, it’s all about the Customer Experience! If you’re the kind of person that relates well to all kinds of people; builds rapport well with others; is easy to approach and talk to; spends extra effort to make others comfortable; is dedicated to meeting the expectations of the Oakley customer and are a good listener, we want to hear from you! Do you have a passion to Drive for Results? We are seeking individuals that can set personal sales goals and achieve them. Oakley Sales Associates understand and acknowledge bottom line results; are able to overcome obstacles and objections and will take initiative beyond assignment or instruction. Do you stay up to date with Oakley Product Knowledge? Are you good at learning new product information? As a Sales Associate you have a natural curiosity for technology; are able to present product benefits and features with genuine passion; can comfortably demonstrate products and find the customer’s connection to Oakley product resulting in a sale. Is Team Working in your DNA? Are you seen as cooperative, positive, and approachable by others and customers? Do you build effective relationships with others quickly and help others to achieve sales results? If so, let us know! Our foundation is built with Integrity and Trust. Sales Associates give honest feedback and fair self-assessment of their own skills, performance, and potential; are honest about their feelings and able to communicate or take appropriate actions; will own up to their mistakes or need for improvement. If this sounds like you, then come join our team!
THE QUALIFIERS 1+ years of customer service experience Ability to read, write, and effectively communicate with store staff and customers Availability to work a flexible schedule and the hours necessary to open and/or close the store, including nights, weekends and holidays Computer and cash register proficiency Must have a professional image and presence Strong verbal communication Self-motivator and motivates others High standard of tact, discretion, and confidentiality Ability to be on your feet most of the day or moving on the sales floor or stock room. The job requires occasional sitting, standing, walking, lifting, carrying, and pulling up to 25 lbs. Must be 18 years of age or older
STOKED IF YOU HAVE THIS TOO Knowledge of Oakley, Inc. and Oakley products Outgoing, enthusiastic and sports-minded individual Bilingual Retail background preferred
Oakley is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job.description:
We have an opening for a Temporary FOOD SVC WORKER position. Location: The Commons at Stonebrook Village Note: online applications accepted only. Schedule: 3:30 PM - 7:00 PM. Requirement: Food service experience preferred.
If you have a positive attitude and a love for learning, you may be interested in joining our team.
Morrison Senior Living, a member of Compass Group North America, is the nation’s only company exclusively dedicated to providing food, nutrition and hospitality services to the senior living industry. Actively committed to fostering ways to enjoy great-tasting, healthy food through socially responsible practices and superior customer service, the Atlanta-based company serves more than 450 senior living clients in 41 states, including some of the largest and most prominent senior living communities in the United States.
Summary: Prepares, presents and serves food as needed. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Performs prep work such as washing, peeling, cutting and seeding fruits and vegetables. Weighs and measures designated ingredients. Carries pans, kettles and trays of food to and from work stations, stove and refrigerator in accordance with safety standards. Stores food in designated areas following wrapping, dating, food safety and rotation procedures. Cleans work areas, equipment and utensils. Distributes supplies, utensils and portable equipment. Utilizes approved food recipes and production standards to ensure proper quality, serving temperatures and standard portion control. Serves customers in a friendly, efficient manner following outlined steps of service. Resolves customer concerns and relays relevant information to supervisor. Ensures compliance with company service standards and inventory and cash control procedures. Assures compliance with all sanitation and safety requirements. Performs other duties as assigned. About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry Compass Group North America is a diversity growth-oriented organization. Our goal is to improve the quality of work life by using fair and consistent treatment and providing equal growth opportunities for ALL associates. job.title: Senior Principal Contract Specialist
job.description:
Your success is a train ride away.Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country and we move America’s workforce toward the future. We employ more than 20,000 diverse, energetic professionals in a variety of career fields throughout the United States. The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority and the success of our railroad is the result of our employees.Are you ready to join our team? SUMMARY OF DUTIES:The Sr. Principal Contract Specialist position will be responsible for overseeing cradle-to-grave procurement of highly complex acquisitions, including but not limited to solicitations relating to the corporation’s marketing function. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Major pre-award responsibilities include, but are not limited to:•Assisting Marketing and other end users, where necessary, in developing clear, concise and contractually-binding scopes of work and evaluation criteria•Issuing highly complex and high dollar value competitive Requests for Proposal (RFP) to qualified third-party firms. Chairing all procurement-related meetings with Amtrak stakeholders and vendors and issuing written amendments to the RFP as required•Receiving and reviewing technical and commercial proposals and overseeing technical and commercial evaluation meetings; chairing oral presentations by prospective builders and Amtrak stakeholders; issue requests for Best and Final Offers if required; negotiate with vendors, as needed•Preparing accurate and comprehensive contract award documentation including power point presentations, white papers, staff summaries, resolutions to Amtrak’s Board of Directors and Fair and Reasonable justifications, etc.
Major post-award responsibilities include, but are not limited to:•Administering contracts to successful completion, formally documenting Contractor’s non-compliance with contractual obligations and requirements, if applicable•Chairing all change order negotiations with end users and Contractor ensuring that resulting change orders are fair and reasonable and accurately define Amtrak’s revised requirements•Preparing and issuing all change order documents and resolving contractual disputes in a manner which minimizes cost and commercial risk to Amtrak•Tracking incentives earned by the Contractor, where applicable and tracking and assessing liquidated damages against the Contractor, where required
WORK EXPERIENCE:•Demonstrated, successful experience in high-stakes contract negotiations, contract award process and ongoing administration of complex, high dollar value contracts•Ability to monitor Contractor’s ongoing performance and accurately and defensibly document non-performance. Assess contractual penalties and incentives, where applicable•Proficient in Microsoft Word, Power Point and Excel•Ability to fully demonstrate understanding of Amtrak’s operations in addition to Procurement and how product/service contribute to total cost•Responsive to end stakeholder’s needs, both internal and external, and able to develop workable solutions sufficient to yield acceptable results•Satisfactory prior job performance is required•Demonstrated skill in consistently and successfully performing contract related functions within tight time frames. Ability to respond quickly and professionally to unforeseen events•Self-starter with superior analytical skills, critical thinking skills and problem solving ability in order to successfully resolve frequent sophisticated contractual issues with minimum oversight required•Superior contractual writing and comprehension skills with minimum oversight required•Must be able to interact skillfully with all levels of Amtrak stakeholders and third-party vendors
PREFERRED WORK EXPERIENCE: •BS in Business Administration or related field, or equivalent combination of education, training and work experience•Masters, C.P.M. or advanced courses in pertinent business, legal or other related areas preferred•Demonstrated experience in high dollar value and complex contract award and administration, particularly in the marketing space•Proficient in ACE, Ariba, Enterprise Project Management (EPM), SAP and where required, Amtrak’s Work Management System (WMS)
COMMUNICATION AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:Experience in oral and in written communication skills within and outside of the organization sufficient to accurately exchange information, work cooperatively, facilitate understanding, and persuade and influence others. Requisition ID:11202Posting Location(s):PennsylvaniaJob Family/Function:Supply Chain & Logistics Relocation Offered:No Education Requirements:Bachelors DegreeTravel Requirements:Up to 25% Employment Experience Requirements:5 - 7 years of experienceAmtrak employees power our progress through their performance.We want your work at Amtrak to be more than a job – we want it to be a fulfilling experience where you find challenging and rewarding opportunities, respect among colleagues, competitive pay, benefits that protect you and your family, and a high performance culture that recognizes and values your contributions and helps you reach your career goals.We proudly support and encourage U.S. Veterans to apply for Amtrak job opportunities.All positions require pre-employment background verification, medical review and pre-employment drug screen. Amtrak is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.POSTING NOTES: Supply Chain & Logistics || Procurement Apply on Career Site

job.title: Manager, Pharmacovigilance Evaluation and Reporting
job.description: Manager, Pharmacovigilance Evaluation and Reporting-00000XHUDescriptionJanssen Research & Development, LLC, a Johnson & Johnson Company, is currently recruiting for a Manager, Pharmacovigilance Evaluation and Reporting (PVER) Scientist, to be located in High Wycombe, UK or Horsham, PA, USA , Titusville, NJ, USA or Raritan, NJ, USA.Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C. develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass novel targets in neurologic disorders, gastroenterology, oncology, infectious disease, diabetes, hematology, metabolic disorders, immunologic disorders, and reproductive medicine.Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a pharmaceutical company of Johnson & Johnson, provides medicines for an array of health concerns in several therapeutic areas, including: attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), cardiovascular disease, general medicine (acid reflux disease, infectious diseases), mental health (bipolar I disorder, schizophrenia), neurologics (Alzheimer’s disease, epilepsy, migraine prevention and treatment), pain management, and women’s health. Our ultimate goal is to help people live healthy lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners, from clinics to hospitals. For more about Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc., one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit www.janssenpharmaceuticalsinc.comThriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.The Manager will be responsible for core safety deliverables including scheduled and ad hoc aggregate reports and will serve as report owner for medium to large and/or complex assigned reports. Will have in-depth product knowledge, serve as product point of contact, and may serve as core Safety Management Team member. Daily activities involve leading strategy development, planning, conducting meetings, database searching, aggregate safety analysis and case level review, writing, project management/coordination of strategic safety documents, and oversight of deliverables produced by other team members. The Manager will partner with team members, stakeholders including Medical Safety officer (MSOs), and a vendor. Will function independently and will have expert knowledge of applicable regulations and guidelines. The Manager will also work closely with Therapeutic Area Lead to support the therapeutic area business.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:Strategically plan and ensure timely, quality reports/safety analyses related to core deliverables. Lead collaboration with Therapeutic Area Safety Head (TASH)/MSO/Pharmacovigilance Physician (PVP) and other stakeholders on strategy development and oversee execution. Independently perform and/or lead aggregate safety analysis and case level review and write, contribute to, and coordinate the preparation of core safety deliverables. Complete complex products reports through coordination and leadership of multiple scientists. Ensure commitments (e.g., PVAs, assessment reports) are met. Partner with vendor to develop reports/deliverables.The Manager will work closely with management to proactively support TA-related business. Provide enhanced Safety Management Team (SMT) support to enable proactive safety management. Act as core member for assigned products. Be responsible for product accountability by maintaining product intelligence (i.e., creating agendas and documenting decisions, milestones, action items in minutes). Deliver innovative solutions for aggregate safety strategy and analysesFor the purpose of Training/Meetings/Audits/Inspections. They will participate in cross-functional training of relevant stakeholders. Act as product or process Subject Matter Expert (SME) during audits/inspections. Participate or lead department and/or cross-functional initiatives.DECISION-MAKING AND PROBLEM-SOLVINGThe Manager will think strategically with respect to data interpretation and provide innovative solutions.Recognize potential issues and or safety issues and escalate to the attention of the line manager or MSO. Have the ability to understand nature of adverse drug reactions and complex associations. High level of flexibility and ability to (re)prioritize work of oneself and others. Attention to detail and ability to analyze data in broader context. Ability to work across multiple functions and therapeutic areas. Be highly proficient in interpretation of regulatory assessor commentsThis position reports into the Pharmacovigilance Evaluation and Reporting Associate Director or Director, TA Lead.QualificationsA minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Health or Biomedical Science with 9+ years of industry experience or equivalent OR an Advanced Degree Preferred in Health or Biomedical Science with 6+ years industry experience or equivalent. A minimum of 3+ years of Clinical/Medical writing or PV experience required.Excellent English verbal and written communication skills are required.High proficiency in the analysis of large and/or complex aggregate data sets is required. Ability to develop in-depth knowledge of assigned products is required. Knowledge of applicable global, regional, and local regulatory requirements (e.g., ICH guidelines) is required.Travel: minimalBE VITAL in your career, Be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.J2W: LI NAJ2W:BIOPrimary Location:North America-United States-Pennsylvania-HorshamOther Locations:Europe/Middle East/Africa-United Kingdom-England-High Wycombe, North America-United States-New Jersey-Titusville, North America-United States-New Jersey-RaritanOrganization: Janssen Research & Development, LLC. Responsibilities include prospecting, cold calling, setting appointments with prospects, presenting programs and meeting a sales quota . Sales Representatives will also transport samples of products for presentations. Cintas provides a thorough sales training program, including product knowledge, mentorship, sales process and business development strategies.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES• Generating revenue and meeting sales targets• Developing and qualifying leads within respective territory to drive additional sales opportunities through cold-calling and lead generation campaigns• Gathering and utilizing business intelligence on prospects to support sales calls, product presentations and driving new business.Qualifications• High School Diploma or GED required; Bachelor’s Degree preferred• Minimum of 1 year outside sales experience or successful completion of a Cintas sales training program required• Valid Driver's License required• New business to business (B2B) sales experience preferred• “Hunter” sales mentality- goal driven and self-motivated• Knowledgeable in Microsoft Office applications (including Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Internet/Intranet) and Contact Management System preferredOur Sales Representatives enjoy:• Solid Base Salary and Commission Potential• Extensive Car Package (Lease/Gas/Insurance/Maintenance Allowance)• Monthly/Quarterly Performance Bonuses & Incentives• Comprehensive 12 week sales training program• Mentorship program• Tablet & AirCard• Annual Recognition Events• 401(k)/Profit Sharing/Employee Stock Ownership Program• Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Package• Disability & Life Insurance Package• Paid Vacation & Holidays• Career Advancement OpportunitiesFor more than 45 years, Cintas Corporation has offered highly-specialized services to businesses of all types. job.title: QSR Manager
job.description:
Position Type: EmployeeFLSA Status: Non-Exempt
Manage and direct the operation of assigned store(s) to maximize profitability by performing the following duties personally or through others. Role modeland demonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety of others. Essential Job Functions: Support the Company Vision and Mission Statements and implements the strategies necessary to achieve them. Ensure that the store is providing the customer service that meets or exceeds Company standards and customer expectations. Responsible for recruiting, selecting and managing a team of sales oriented associates who perform at levels consistent with our corporate objectives. Accountable for building store sales and gross profits through implementation of corporate merchandising policies, procedures, and programs. Supervise all store employees in a fair, consistent, impartial, and timely way, and in accordance with all E.E.O. guidelines. Support, uphold, and enforce all Company policies as well as local, state, and federal laws/regulations including the local Health Department andKroger Food Safety standards. Assure that personnel processes (hiring, training, employee evaluations, employee discipline and termination actions) are carried out in a legal andethical manner. Ensure that the store operates within established inventory levels, salary budgets (and other controllable expenses), and gross profit margins toachieve maximum profitability. Accountable for building store sales and gross profits through implementation of corporate merchandising policies, procedures, and programs. Merchandise all items to provide the highest levels of sales. Ensure that the store is properly supplied and merchandised. Maintain fresh and appealingdisplays with proper signs. Regularly completes merchandise price surveys of the competition and observes competitors for changes in the street price of gasoline. Adjust the storepricing per established policy. Maintain high standards of food safety to ensure food is maintained at proper time and temperature by regularly monitoring and documenting as required. Ensure information flows to all QSR associates and advises management of significant events affecting the store or the market. Responsible for building an environment of teamwork between all Store Associates, supervision and vendors. Supervise and coach direct reports in the performance of their duties; complete performance reviews and provides feedback to direct reports. Must be able to perform the essential functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation. Minimum Position Qualifications: 2-3 years experience working in a QSR establishment. Ability to successfully pass Food Safety Certification. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, andoccasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Must be available to work all hours as assigned including but not limited to early morning or evening hours that may include overtime. Desired Previous Job Experience High School diploma or college helpful Proficient computer skills Current Food Safety Certification
Education Level: NoneRequired Certifications/Licenses: NonePosition Type: Full-Time Shift(s): Day; Evening; OvernightRegions: Any States: PennsylvaniaKeywords:

We offer competitive wages and benefits, a flexible schedule and room for career advancement. If you're interested in a job opportunity with Turkey Hill Minit Markets, we welcome you to complete an online application today.
Company OverviewKroger, one of the world's largest retailers, employs more than 368,000 associates who serve customers in 2,641 supermarkets and multi-department stores in 34 states and the District of Columbia under two dozen local banner names including Kroger, City Market, Dillons, Food 4 Less, Fred Meyer, Fry's, Harris Teeter, Jay C, King Soopers, QFC, Ralphs and Smith's. Kroger contributes food and funds equal to 200 million meals a year through more than 80 Feeding America food bank partners. A leader in supplier diversity, Kroger is a proud member of the Billion Dollar Roundtable and the U.S. Hispanic Chamber's Million Dollar Club.

job.title: Guest Services Associate - Seasonal - Wyndham Shawnee Village Resort
job.description:
2015 Seasonal Guest Services Associate (Mid-May through Labor Day)
The Guest Services Associate will be responsible for providing excellent guest service as it pertains to guest registration/checking out of resort. He/She will promptly address guest service needs, provide resort information and area attraction details and directions, maintain unit vacancy inventory, reservations, and room assignments, process guest folios, collect payment, and accurately manage cash receipts. He/she will maintain the companyâ€™s expected high quality standards and will follow all safety protocols as dictated by company policy and maintain Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), including the new Global Harmonized System (GHS) regulations.
Essential Job Functions
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Responsible for the Guest Services function of the resort: Promptly greet guests in a friendly and professional manner. Complete guest registration process, issue unit keys, and provide resort information and area attractions details and directions. Accurately process all cash and credit card transactions in accordance with established procedures. Balance all cash receipts and work performed during shift and perform a bucket check on shift, post all guest charges, complete cashier and other reports, preparing deposit, and counting/securing of assigned bank. Complete check-out procedures, compute bills, verify that the correct charges and credits are posted to the corresponding guest folio, collect payment and makes changes as required. May routinely reserve and confirm guest reservations for individuals and/or groups that are requested either by phone or from within the company; process cancellations, revisions, and information updates on changes. Make pre-arrival informational calls to booked incoming guests, confirm and cancel reservations for guests and answer a variety of questions for guests pertaining to their reservations. Provides quotes for room rates (35% time) Maintain positive guest, owner and associate relationships: Respond appropriately to guest inquiries and concerns to ensure total guest satisfaction. Resolve guest issues to resolution in effort to improve the guest experience and escalate any outstanding guest inquiries or concerns to management that may require additional monitoring or follow-up. Make appropriate service recovery recommendations. Promote team work and quality service through daily communications and coordination with other departments. (35% time) Ensure compliance with: Internal Audit, Quality Assurance, Loss Prevention, Resort Operating Procedures, Guest Service Department Operating Procedures, and Standard Operating Procedures. (15% time) Cultivate a â€œCount On Meâ€ Culture: Continuously exhibit the companyâ€™s Count on Me philosophy; be responsive to the needs of our guests, associates and all we come into contact with on the job, be respectful in every way; deliver a great experience. (10% time) Performs other duties as needed. (5% time) QualificationsMinimum Requirements and Qualificationsa) Education High School diploma or equivalent b) Training requirements N/A c) Knowledge and skills Organizational Skills. Excellent communication skills. Acquires job skills and learns company policies and procedures to complete routine tasks. Ability to read and comprehend routine instructions, short correspondence and memos. Ability to give high priority to customer service. Ability to solve problems with a minimum of supervision. Ability to read, write and understand English. Basic office skills helpful including basic math, proper cash handling procedures. Must maintain a professional appearance and a Can-Do, positive attitude towards all guests and staff. Ability to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment. Must be people oriented and able to work independently or with others as needed. Must be detail oriented. d) Technical Skills PC Skills and Knowledge Ability to use basic office equipment including Fax, copier, printers Microsoft Office: Word, excel, outlook Key systems Hotel Hospitality Front office system knowledge a plus Must be able to easily and frequently change from one activity to another while operating a switchboard or computer keyboard e) Job experience 1 year of guest services experience in a hospitality/hotel/resort environment and/or 1 year of customer service experience in service or retail environment Unless there is a legal requirement, experience will be accepted for the education requirement. *Must be 18 years of age or older to apply*Available to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends and holidays*WVO requires the successful completion of a background check prior to employment Job: Hotel/Resort Operations-Guest ServicesEmployee Status: Full TimeSchedule: VariableOrganization: Wyndham Vacation ResortsJob Number: 1501884 Apply on Career Site

job.title: Retail Sales Training Supervisor
job.description: Returning Candidate?Log back in!Retail Sales Training SupervisorReq ID: 2015-14954Location Name: NRG Energy Plus Corporate HeadquartersCategory: Retail OperationsState/City: US-PA-PhiladelphiaType: Full-Time Salary# Openings: 1Details About this Career Opportunity:Overview:NRG is leading a customer-driven change in the U.S. energy industry by delivering cleaner and smarter energy choices, while building on the strength of the nation’s largest and most diverse competitive power portfolio. A Fortune 250 company, we create value through reliable and efficient conventional generation while driving innovation in solar and renewable power, electric vehicle ecosystems, carbon capture technology and customer-centric energy solutions. Our retail electricity providers serve almost 3 million residential and commercial customers throughout the country. More information is available at www.nrgenergy.com. Connect with NRG Energy on Facebook and follow us on Twitter @nrgenergyResponsibilities:Retail Sales Training Supervisor will oversee all aspects of training for the NE retail organization and assists the Manager of QA/ Training in certifying new trainers, administering updates to training materials and providing enhancements to the program across the Northeast markets in order for sales agents to follow approved messaging, presentations, materials, set-ups and uniform standardsThe Retail Sales Training Supervisor's role requires a high attention to detail and organization. This individual will spend at least 50% of his/her time in the field training, certifying and mentoring our vendor D2D and Retail & Events sales managers, agents and trainers. They will also be responsible for enhancing the training materials and modernizing the training program including the development of new training vehicles like online training modules, video training, audio training and trainer/ trainee interactivity.1. Manage sales training program for in-house and vendor sales agents for all NRG brands in SFE, Retail and D2D sales channels2. Ensure that each market/ vendor has certified trainers and conducts periodic re-certifications with trainers to ensure the most up to date information is out to the sales organization.3. Ensure all training materials are compliant and have comprehensive messaging that aligns with regulatory and brand requirements4. Disseminate relevant training materials via email/ website/ in person and assure that training updates are distributed to vendor and in-house sales management within 24hrs of the development/change/enhancement.5. Effectively communicates and partners with Sales, Regulatory, Legal and Marketing to assure compliance, provide feedback and enhance the sales training program.6. Assist in the training of vendor sales agents and assure that all sales agents are trained by an approved trainer with an emphasis on trainer enthusiasm, engagement and positive energy.7. Assure sales groups are using the most recent version of all training materials.8. Report back to QA management on progress of certification program and suggest enhancements9. Commitment to spending the necessary time in the office and field to ensure quality messaging is being utilized by sales agents/ vendors.10. Establish periodic feedback sessions with vendor management/ trainers to ensure a comprehensive approach to the training program.11. Owns the repository for all training tests/ scoring and any compliance training12. Improves current training delivery systems to include on-line, video and audio training.Qualifications:• 2 years of experience in a sales environment, outside sales, retention, and/or customer care activity and training• Familiarity with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a sales environment• Bilingual - Spanish Preferred• Ability to work independently with little direction, set goals, multitask, and prioritize competing responsibilities.• Ability to confidently and comfortably present information to a variety of levels within the organization including upper management.• Strong proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office software products required.• 2 years experience in training sales professionals• Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or related area preferred.Strong documentation skillsSuperior training skillsExperience in developing online, video and audio training preferred”NRG Energy is committed to a drug and alcohol free workplace. To the extent permitted by law and any applicable collective bargaining agreement, employees are subject to periodic random drug testing, and post-accident and reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing.EOE AA M/F/Protected Veteran Status/DisabilityLevel, Title and/or Salary may be adjusted based on the applicant’s experience or skills.Official description on file with Human ResourcesInterested in this opportunity?- Apply online now!Apply for this job onlineRefer a friend to this jobGo back to the welcome pageApplication FAQsSoftware Powered by iCIMSwww.icims.com Apply on Career Site

job.title: Post-doctoral Research Scientist, Janssen Research & Development
job.description: Johnson & Johnson companies are equal opportunity employers. Post-doctoral Research Scientist, Janssen Research & Development (Malvern, PA)-3141150403DescriptionJanssen Research & Development, LLC, a Johnson & Johnson Company, is hiring a Post-doctoral Research Scientist, to be located in Malvern, PA.Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C. develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass novel targets in neurologic disorders, gastroenterology, oncology, infectious disease, diabetes, hematology, metabolic disorders, immunologic disorders, and reproductive medicine.Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a pharmaceutical company of Johnson & Johnson, provides medicines for an array of health concerns in several therapeutic areas, including: attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), cardiovascular disease, general medicine (acid reflux disease, infectious diseases), mental health (bipolar I disorder, schizophrenia), neurologics (Alzheimer’s disease, epilepsy, migraine prevention and treatment), pain management, and women’s health. Our ultimate goal is to help people live healthy lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners, from clinics to hospitals. For more about Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc., one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit http://www.janssenpharmaceuticalsinc.com/Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to Diversity & Inclusion, Janssen Research & Development, LLC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.The Post-doctoral Research Scientist will be part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Development Large Molecule API team. The successful candidate will contribute to an overall team effort to create and characterize new recombinant multi-specific monoclonal antibodies. The candidate will work independently and as part of a team to characterize the protein chemistry central to the structure of the multi-specific antibodies. This increased knowledge will be applied to the therapeutic antibodies, and other recombinant proteins for direct biomedical applications and basic studies on structure-function relationships.The candidate’s primary responsibilities will include leading and participating in the design of experiments and executing the planned experiments. The candidate will record and analyze experimental data, verify data integrity and accuracy, and report/summarize findings to the project lead and the project team, and also draft technical documents. The candidate is expected to work in a team environment as well as contributing individually to meet project timeline and objectives.QualificationsA Ph.D. and training in laboratory methods in Protein Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemistry or a related field are required with an associated minor in Organic Chemistry and Organic Synthesis. Strong written and verbal communication skills are required. Primary publications in refereed English language journals are preferred. Protien Chemistry Organic Chemistry.Preference will be given to individuals with working laboratory experience in methods of protein chemistry, purification, separation, spectroscopy (UV-Vis, fluorescence), mass spectrometry and/or therapeutic antibody or protein development and assays. Expertise in sulfhydryl chemistry is also preferred.The candidate must be highly organized and capable of managing/pursuing multiple projects, both working independently and working in a team environment. Experience maintaining written records of work in the form of (electronic) notebooks, technical reports and protocols is required. Data reporting, ability to present findings to management, and experience with team-based collaborations is required.BE VITAL in your career, Be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.J2W:BIOPrimary Location:North America-United States-Pennsylvania-MalvernOrganization: Janssen Research & Development, LLC. (6084)Job Function: AdministrationCertain sites within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies participate in E-Verify as appropriate in accordance with Company guidelines and federal or state law. To learn more about the government sponsored program and to see a list of the sites that are currently enrolled, please click here.Johnson and Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. job.title: Clinical Program Leader (CPL) –Oncology
job.description: Clinical Program Leader (CPL) –Oncology-00000X9WDescriptionJanssen Research and Development, L.L.C., a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Clinical Program Leader (CPL) –Oncology to be located in Spring House, PA or Raritan or Titusville, NJ or Los Angeles or La Jolla, CA or UK or BE or NL.Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C. develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass novel targets in neurologic disorders, gastroenterology, oncology, infectious disease, diabetes, hematology, metabolic disorders, immunologic disorders, and reproductive medicine.The position is accountable for the successful execution of local, regional and/or global clinical trials for assigned programs/projects within a Therapeutic Area (TA), including adequate planning and resource allocation, deliverables within agreed timelines and budget, with high quality and meeting all the SOP and regulatory requirements.This position acts as the single point of accountability at the program/project level and has direct interface with the correspondent Research & Development Company (R&DC) and/or sponsor clinical teams and regional Trial Coordination and Site Management (TCSM) in the management of clinical trials. As applicable, this position is responsible for the coordination of all activities performed by the Global Trial Managers (GTM) assigned to her/his program/project of responsibility. As applicable, is responsible for the line management and development of all GTMs and Global Trial Manager Clinical Trial Assistants (GTM-CTA) assigned to her/his program/project. Supports the development of Human Resources programs which may include Performance and Development Management (PDM), talent management and training requirements.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:Drive the start-up of assigned programs/projects. Establish interaction with the assigned members of the R&DC/sponsor clinical team. Align with the R&DC/sponsor clinical team on accurate planning of trials within program/project and ensure information is available to GCO. Discuss Clinical Development Plans and key Operational TA questions with Clinical Operations Head (COH).In close interaction with the clinical team ensure timely availability to GCO of Protocol Design Elements/Protocol and critical TA operational questions important for protocol feasibility, allowing optimal preparation of the trial. Own Request for Service (RFS), give operational input in design and implementation of the protocol. Provide Proposal for acceptance and execution of a clinical trial by GCO. Provide key assumptions to RFS in terms of outsourcing needs/vendors. Partner with TCSM, Integrated Dated Services (IDS), Clinical Development Operations (CDO), Clinical Supply Unit (CSU), and Global Operational Services (GOS) in the preparation and assumptions that make up the RFS.Drive the execution and close of assigned programs/projects. Link with the Project Management Office ((PMO)(Clinical Program Managers (CPMs)/Program Coordinators (PCs)) for program/project related milestones and resource planning.As applicable, ensure availability of GTMs and GTM-CTAs and be accountable for their performance. Be apprised of the efforts of the Study Management Teams (SMT) across the programs/projects and ensure operational consistencyFoster optimal communication with the GTMs, TCSM, IDS, CDO, GOS, Global Supply Management (GSM), Global Medical Safety (GMS), Quality Management & Training (QM&T), Therapeutic Area Clinical Quality Assurance (TACQA)Ensure timely feedback on deliverables reporting into the R&DC/sponsor clinical team. Communicate updates from the R&DC/sponsor clinical team to all functions within GCO, IDS and GOS. Have key input into resolving issues and issue escalation decision making for assigned programs/projects. Communicate timely trial updates and issue escalation to COH. Review proposal for action plan(s) developed by GTMs and SMTs. Work with R&DC/sponsor clinical teams and SMTs to implement solutions on a program/project level. Ensure that the operational objectives in projects assigned are met in conformance to all relevant laws, regulations, guidelines and internal SOPs/policies as laid out in the End to End (E2E) process map.As applicable, manage and develop all GTMs and GTM-CTAs assigned to her/his program/project. Supports the development of Human Resources programs which may include Performance PDM, talent management and training requirements.Acquire and sustain advanced knowledge of the therapeutic area and product and clinical trial setting in the TA. Establish strong interaction with the COH and with other CPLs within and across TAsQualificationsBachelor’s Degree or equivalent degree is required. Advanced degree in a scientific discipline and/or Master Degree is preferred.At least 10 years operations experience in clinical trials with a pharmaceutical company and/or a CRO is required. Oncology/hematology experience is required.Expertise in the areas of drug development and strategic planning, specifically management of clinical trial operations is required. Full understanding of all logistical aspects when conducting local, regional and/or global clinical trials is required. Functional management experience of direct reports excluding matrix structure reporting is preferred. Must have demonstrated experience managing and mentoring clinical operations team members. Effective leadership skills and proven ability to foster team productivity and cohesiveness is required. Excellent communication skills and the innate flexibility to work in a rapidly growing/changing organization is required.BE VITAL in your career, Be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.Primary Location:North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Spring HouseOther Locations:Europe/Middle East/Africa-Belgium, North America-United States-California-Los Angeles, Europe/Middle East/Africa-Netherlands, North America-United States-New Jersey, North America-United States-Pennsylvania, North America-United States-California-La Jolla, Europe/Middle East/Africa-United KingdomOrganization: Janssen Research & Development, LLC. job.title: LAUNDRY SVC (PART-TIME)
job.description:
We have an opening for a part-time LAUNDRY SVC position. Location: Lutheran Home at Topton, 1 S. Home Ave., Topton, PA 19562. Note: online applications accepted only. Schedule: Every other weekend. Requirement: No experience required.
If you have a positive attitude and a love for learning, you may be interested in joining our team.
Morrison Senior Living, a member of Compass Group North America, is the nation’s only company exclusively dedicated to providing food, nutrition and hospitality services to the senior living industry. Actively committed to fostering ways to enjoy great-tasting, healthy food through socially responsible practices and superior customer service, the Atlanta-based company serves more than 450 senior living clients in 41 states, including some of the largest and most prominent senior living communities in the United States.
Summary: Perform laundry services including cleaning and distributing linens to clients. Also contributing to team efforts and professionally interacting with clients, customers, and team members. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Properly sorts, washes and dries linens following the approved laundry procedures. Folds, counts and stacks linens following approved laundry procedures. Collects soiled linens along with redistributing clean linens. Transports supplies to include clean and soiled linen to the appropriate storage and collection areas. Provides quality customer service to customers by providing one on one attention to the detail. Routinely inspects linens for wear and tear, identifying worn and torn linens and following Standard Operating Procedure for damaged linens. Maintains the commercial and residential laundry rooms in a clean, orderly and sanitary condition. Performs other duties as assigned. About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry Compass Group North America is a diversity growth-oriented organization. Our goal is to improve the quality of work life by using fair and consistent treatment and providing equal growth opportunities for ALL associates. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to race, sex, religion, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity.

job.title: Associate Director, Health Economics & Outcomes Research (HECOR), Oncology (1 of 2)
job.description: Associate Director, Health Economics & Outcomes Research (HECOR), Oncology (1 of 2)-0395140515DescriptionJanssen Scientific Affairs, a member of Johnson & Johnson’s family of companies, is recruiting for an Associate Director, Health Economics & Outcomes Research (HECOR) Oncology, to be located in Horsham, PA.The Associate Director, Health Economics & Outcomes Research (HECOR) is responsible for leading outcomes research activities in support of the value proposition for the Oncology portfolio. This individual will contribute to outcomes-based strategies and development of tactics to support business units outcomes research strategic plan. The Associate Director, HECOR will collaborate with internal and external clinical and outcomes experts to generate rigorous scientific data and plan for its publication and dissemination to support the strategic plan. This individual will ensure quality of design, execution, and publication of outcomes research studies and quality of models & tools developed for business partners. The Associate Director will develop relevant outcomes research budget, present to appropriate levels of management for approval, and manage budgeted funds. This role will represent HECOR on assigned cross-functional franchise teams, with internal partners such as HECOR colleagues, Marketing, Strategic Customer Group, Medical Affairs, Medical Science Liaisons, Global Market Access, Epidemiology, Government Affairs and Policy, and other J&J Operating Companies.Responsibilities of the Associate Director include the design, implementation, and direct management of outcomes research studies and the development of models/tools from concept through publication. The Associate Director is expected to clearly articulate key research questions, recommend appropriate research methods, and ensure quality/compliance in internal / external communications including publications, training support of HECOR studies and models & tools developed for the therapeutic area. The Associate Director will develop a relevant HECOR budget, present to appropriate levels of management for approval, and manage budgeted funds. This individual will provide input to Medical Affairs on the development of Phase 3b & IV protocols to measure outcomes endpoints; also provide input on the post-hoc analysis of trial data to generate relevant outcomes information. The Associate Director will collaborate with Translational Science Team (TST) on research projects including championing approvals of new presentation materials and handling administrative responsibilities, as needed.QualificationsA minimum of a Master’s degree in Public Health, Health Services Research, Economics, Epidemiology, Health Policy, or a related discipline is required; a doctorate or other advanced degree is preferred. A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience is required. Experience in outcomes-based strategies and tactics to meet both commercial and scientific objectives for a given product is required. Experience in conducting outcomes research studies applying health economics, patient-reported outcomes, retrospective and prospective data analyses, epidemiology or health services research is required. Solid project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously is required. Experience in the use of common research data sources, designing studies, and interpreting data is required. Working knowledge of drug development and the regulatory approval process is preferred. Working knowledge of United States health care systems and customers - specifically understanding business models and perspectives of managed care, long term care, and public sector - is preferred. Understanding of the uses of evidence-based medicine and comparative effectiveness for health policy decision-making is preferred. Working knowledge of regulatory and commercial compliance issues relating to conducting research and disseminating of scientific information is required. Excellent skills in collaboration, influencing and communication (both written and presentation) are required. Proven medical writing skills (published papers, posters, and abstracts) is required. This role may require up to 15% travel.Primary Location:North America-United States-Pennsylvania-HorshamOrganization: Janssen Scientific Affairs, LLC (6120)Job Function: Health Economics R&DCertain sites within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies participate in E-Verify as appropriate in accordance with Company guidelines and federal or state law. job.title: Senior Scientist, Pharmacovigilance Evaluation & Reporting
job.description: Senior Scientist, Pharmacovigilance Evaluation & Reporting-00000XHTDescriptionJanssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for a Senior Scientist, Pharmacovigilance Evaluation & Reporting to be located in High Wycombe, UK or Horsham, PA, USA , Titusville, NJ, USA or Raritan, NJ, USA.Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C. develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass novel targets in neurologic disorders, gastroenterology, oncology, infectious disease, diabetes, hematology, metabolic disorders, immunologic disorders, and reproductive medicine.Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a pharmaceutical company of Johnson & Johnson, provides medicines for an array of health concerns in several therapeutic areas, including: attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), cardiovascular disease, general medicine (acid reflux disease, infectious diseases), mental health (bipolar I disorder, schizophrenia), neurologics (Alzheimer’s disease, epilepsy, migraine prevention and treatment), pain management, and women’s health. Our ultimate goal is to help people live healthy lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners, from clinics to hospitals. For more about Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc., one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit www.janssenpharmaceuticalsinc.comThriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.The Senior Scientist will be part of the Safety Management team. They will be responsible for core safety deliverables including scheduled and ad hoc aggregate reports and will serve as report owner for assigned reports (medium to large volume, standard complexity). The Senior Scientist will have in-depth product knowledge and will support Safety Management Team deliverables as required. Daily activities involve planning, conducting meetings, database searching, aggregate safety analysis and case level review, writing, project management/coordination of strategic safety documents, and oversight of deliverables produced by other team members. The Senior Scientist will partner with team members, stakeholders including Medical Safety Officers (MSOs), and a vendor.The Senior Scientist will ensure timely, quality reports/safety analyses related to core deliverables with oversight as appropriate. They will collaborate with Therapeutic Area Safety Head (TASH)/MSO/Pharmacovigilance Physician and other stakeholders on strategy development. Initiate/conduct/oversee searches of internal and external databases. Perform and/or lead aggregate safety analysis and case level review. The Senior Scientist will author, contribute, and coordinate the preparation of core safety deliverables. Ensure commitments (e.g., PVAs, assessment reports) are met and partner with vendor to develop reports/deliverables. They will provide SMT support as needed and act as ad hoc member for assigned products as appropriate.The Senior Scientist will participate in cross-functional training of relevant stakeholders and act as product or process SME during audits/inspections. They will participate or lead department and/or cross-functional initiatives. Recognize potential issues and or safety issues and escalate to the attention of the report owner, line manager, or MSO. They will have the ability to understand the nature of adverse drug reactions and complex associations. High level of flexibility and ability to (re) prioritize work of oneself and others. Attention to detail and ability to analyze data in broader context. They will have the ability to work across multiple functions and therapeutic areas. Review regulatory assessor comments/requests and accommodate/address as appropriate with guidance.QualificationsA minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Health or Biomedical Science with a minimum of 6 years industry experience or equivalent OR an Advanced Degree Preferred in Health or Biomedical Science with a minimum of 4 years industry experience or equivalent is required. Clinical/Medical writing or Pharmacovigilance experience preferred. Strong English verbal and written communication skills are required. Working knowledge of applicable global, regional, and local regulatory requirements (eg, ICH guidelines) is highly preferred. There will be up to 10% travel.BE VITAL in your career. Be seen for the talent you bring to work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.J2W: LI NAJ2W: BIOPrimary Location:North America-United States-Pennsylvania-HorshamOther Locations:Europe/Middle East/Africa-United Kingdom-England-High Wycombe, North America-United States-New Jersey-Titusville, North America-United States-New Jersey-RaritanOrganization: Janssen Research & Development, LLC. (6084)Job Function: Drug & Product Safety ScienceCertain sites within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies participate in E-Verify as appropriate in accordance with Company guidelines and federal or state law. job.title: Senior Process & Tech Transfer Engineer
job.description: Senior Process & Tech Transfer Engineer-1321150319DescriptionPharmaceutical Development & Manufacturing Sciences (PDMS) is part of the global Janssen Research & Development organization within Johnson & Johnson and is currently recruiting for a Senior Process & Tech Transfer Engineer - Drug Product Clinical Supply Chain. This position supports US Clinical Supply Drug Product, position is located in PA or NJ site.The PDMS Clinical Supply Chain holds the global responsibility all clinical supplies of Janssen Research & Development. Our activities include all in-house and outsourced planning, manufacturing and distribution of clinical supplies (API, Drug Product, Packaged Clinical Supplies), through a global network. We supply more than 60.000 patients in more than 300 clinical trials every year.The Process & Tech Transfer Engineer is responsible for technology and scale-up support to the Pharmaceutical Development and Technical Integrator group as well as to the Clinical Manufacturing in Pilot Plant, External Contract Manufacturing Organizations and Pack & Label activities to provide Drug Product for use in global clinical trials.Assignment covers: Process engineering expertise input to the Drug Product Development teams. Concept, Design, Installation and Implementation of new equipment and PAT applications. Support optimizations and / or changes to existing equipment. Due diligence assessments of CMO for clinical trial material manufacture, including equipment and facility assessments to confirm capability to manufacture drug products from formulation and fill finish at internal and external manufacturing sites, and clinical packaging at Pack & Label facilities. E2E responsibility for the manufacture of clinical trial material meeting the clinical demand schedule.Tech Transfer support includes commercial plant readiness for registration, launch and commercial production, DoE & Scale-up support.Compliance responsibilities: Being informed about applicable internal and external rules (guidelines, laws…) with respect to requirements for equipment and relevant processes (literature, workshops, seminars…). Project management: This information/knowledge must be applied in all projects where applicable, hence the following responsibilities: Process- and SHE-integrated approach (V-model, IQ, OQ, PQ, Safety analysis…). Setup of the required cross-linked information platforms (QA, Manufacturing, Prevention, PDMS/JSC…).Budget responsibilities: The engineer will take responsibility as a devoted housekeeper. He has strong responsibility with respect to the dedicated project budget, He will have full control of budget and cost during project realization in order to fulfill the financial restrictions. Personnel responsibilities: The project engineer draws up a (global) project team with members out of different disciplines and with different functions that have their contribution to the project realization. The management of this team must lead to the required performances in order to realize the project objectives.External contacts: For small as well as for large projects, extensive contacts with different suppliers/contractors can be necessary in order to achieve the required project results. This means mutual exchange of information e.g. managing confidentiality agreements, applicable internal standards, user & process specifications, functional specifications, product information …Benchmarking and updating internal knowledge means contact with and information exchanges with other pharmaceutical companies during workshops, seminars…Must be able to work with Contract Manufacturing Organizations to perform capability assessments and provide technical expertise to influence and bridge gap analysis to meet Clinical Trial Material requirements.Internal contacts: Main clients are Pharmaceutical Development and Manufacturing and Pack & Label within PDMS. In order to understand their needs, frequent contacts with production management, operators are extremely important for project definition and progress. Furthermore, intensive collaboration with Technical Integrators and Design Lead is required. Contacts with all members of the project team of the different involved departments are common (i.e. Quality Assurance, Qual/Val, Engineering, SHE, Global Technical Services, TLI …). Frequent review meetings with Technical Services for maintenance and calibration activities.QualificationsKnowledge of sterilization technology, parenteral processes including fill/finish, small and large molecules: conventional as well as innovative platforms like lyophilisation, nanomilling, and nasal spray is required. Specific expertise: Process Engineering & Scale-up, Pack &Label, Process Analytical Technology, and Clinical Manufacturing are required. The option of knowledge in oral solids processes and/or liquids dosage products, processes and technology systems would be beneficial is preferred. Elementary technical background (mechanics, electrical, PLC, pneumatics, HVAC…) is required. Chemical, Mechanical or Pharmaceutical Process Engineering degree preferred or equivalent with at least 10 years in pharmaceutical area required. A minimum of a B.S. plus 10 years is required, or a M.S. plus 8 years required. Candidates with Engineering and Science backgrounds with strong equipment and facility experience will be considered. GXP, Regulatory requirements, J&J is preferred, JPh-standards & guidelines is required, applicable Standard Operating Procedures, Engineering Technical Standards, Technical Safety Standards, Industrial Hygiene Standards, MS office applications required. Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written) is required.Elementary concepts of HVAC-systems required. Isolator, cleanroom technology and high containment systems required. Sterile liquids manufacturing systems incl. compounding, fill finish, and pack and label required. Oral solid dose manufacturing systems incl. granulation, compression, coating, pack and label blister and bottle packaging preferred. IPC and monitoring systems required. Basic concepts of CSV (computer system validation) systems required. Equipment qualification, validation and change management systems required. Specific tools such as ATS (analytical trouble shooting), PE (process excellence tools), Planning tools (MS-project) preferred. Good documentation practices required.Position is located within PA/NJ sites and require up to 30% of travel domestically and minor international travel.BE VITAL in your Career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.J2W:LI NAPrimary Location:North America-United States-Pennsylvania-MalvernOther Locations:North America-United States-New Jersey, North America-United States-PennsylvaniaOrganization: Janssen Research & Development, LLC.
